revisions:
[{'created': '2015-05-28 22:27:17.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Let L3-agent report state before start fullsync during startup

Change-Id: Id40cfd8466f45e20fea0e9df6fd57bf9c9e59da7
', 'number': 1}, {'created': '2015-05-29 04:41:50.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Don't print RPC error traceback at L3 agent start

Sometimes the AgentNotFoundByTypeHost exception is reported at
L3-agent startup. The exception is generated when the first
get_routers RPC call is made. When the neutron server gets this
RPC call, it might not have handled the report state RPC call yet.
So the L3-agent hasn't been registered in the API server.
The result is a RPC Error exception.  By the time the next
get_routers RPC call is made, the report state RPC call has already
been done and agent registered.

This patch prints out a warning message instead of the full exception
traceback when the first get_routers RPC call raises an exception.
This error is fixed this way in order to avoid having the L3-agent
delaying the get_routers RPC call until the report state RPC call
returns.

Closes-bug: 1456822
Change-Id: Id40cfd8466f45e20fea0e9df6fd57bf9c9e59da7

commit_message:
L3 agent should do report state before full sync at start

Sometimes the AgentNotFoundByTypeHost exception is reported during
L3-agent startup. The exception is generated when the first
get_routers RPC call is made. When the neutron server gets this
RPC call, it might not have handled the report state RPC call yet.
So the L3-agent hasn't been registered in the API server.
The result is a RPC Error exception.  By the time the next
get_routers RPC call is made, the report state RPC call has already
been done and agent registered.

This patch modifies the L3 agent startup behavior to have the report
state done before the agent do the sync routers RPC call.

Closes-bug: 1456822
Change-Id: Id40cfd8466f45e20fea0e9df6fd57bf9c9e59da7

commit_message:
Enable specifying domain for group and role commands

Many of the commands for the group and role resources were lacking an
option to specify the specific domain groups, projects or users belong
to. This commit fixes that.

Change-Id: I461d2bcfd01ad2dea970de38ec7ad6f4a631ceb1
Closes-bug: #1446546

commit_message:
Switch to plugin base: context, sla, runners

This patch attempts to switch to plugin base
and unify context sla and runners plugins.

*) Context, Runners, and SLA inherit Plugin class

*) Remove Context, Runners and SLA implementations of plugin methods

*) Use Meta for Context order and hidden options

*) Fix rally-info to use new kind of plugins

Change-Id: I5f13e07fa4d3048f86e7d7ef0ee39f9701463838

subject: Block oslo.middleware 2.0.0
revisions:
[{'created': '2015-06-09 17:58:54.000000000', 'files': ['global-requirements.txt'], 'message': "Block oslo.middleware 2.0.0

oslo.middleware dropped namespace support which is breaking
several API services during upgrades (grenade jobs) because
the api_paste.ini isn't updated from kilo - which is using
the old oslo.middleware package.

The change is being reverted and then a new release of
oslo.middleware will be pushed.

Change-Id: I08d22cbf3d4161be76628d63a782692b91e4854c
Closes-Bug: #1463478
", 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Block oslo.middleware 2.0.0

oslo.middleware dropped namespace support which is breaking
several API services during upgrades (grenade jobs) because
the api_paste.ini isn't updated from kilo - which is using
the old oslo.middleware package.

The change is being reverted and then a new release of
oslo.middleware will be pushed.

Change-Id: I08d22cbf3d4161be76628d63a782692b91e4854c
Closes-Bug: #1463478

commit_message:
Add log for volume status if it failed

Matt Riedemann pointed We only tell the volume status is not active,
but we didn't say it's status, so it's hard to debug.
This patch adds the info.

Change-Id: I27380696b0dfc2dc852c5f5142e7c12dbdb11b21

commit_message:
Move pool dispose() before os.fork

Currently pool dispose() is done after os.fork, but this will
produce shared DB connections in child processes which may lead
to DB errors.

Move pool dispose() before os.fork. This will remove all existing
connections in the parent process and child processes will create
their own new ones.

(cherry-picked from 88e499d1c10eaae59546d9f16c9c9c262766de84)

Change-Id: Ie36417a64f0eb39b53dad61517f834aec37bacfb
Closes-Bug: 1458718

commit_message:
Add very initial support for passing in occ object

We've got a split personality in terms of whether we should use or not
use os-client-config... except we have a hard dependency on it. Maybe we
should just use it.

commit_message:
Automate selection of active bond slave

This change selects an interface to be the active slave in a bond
with active/passive characteristics. If one of the interfaces is
marked as primary, it will be the active slave. If none of the
interfaces are marked, the interface with the lowest alphanumeric
value will be chosen. For instance em2 comes before em3.

Co-Authored-By: Dan Prince <dprince@redhat.com>

Change-Id: Ib448bedb928fba61e26e134dca08c569de629e3c

Add l3-agent to process checks in neutron plugin

neutron-l3-agent is a critical neutron agent which needs to be
monitored.  This change adds that process check.

commit_message:
Removed unreachable 'else' block

While loop else block of _check_clone_status() method is
not reachable in any case because value of 'running'
will always be 'True'.

Moved 'else' block code outside to make it reachable.

Closes-Bug: #1461926
Change-Id: Ia7cc2e18b93b612e541ec4c7fd51c90876e563e0

revisions:
[{'created': '2015-06-09 16:01:55.000000000', 'files': ['jenkins/scripts/merge_tags.sh'], 'message': "Add an explanation to release tag merges

Merge commits look strange in Gerrit to begin with, and the
reasoning behind release tag merges is unknown to many of our
community, even core reviewers of prominent projects. Better commit
messages, along with evangelization from release management and
infra, should go a long way toward making sure they're approved in a
timely fashion.

Change-Id: I4521e37ee276b6182dd29cc02fba78861ea8d95e
", 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Add an explanation to release tag merges

Merge commits look strange in Gerrit to begin with, and the
reasoning behind release tag merges is unknown to many of our
community, even core reviewers of prominent projects. Better commit
messages, along with evangelization from release management and
infra, should go a long way toward making sure they're approved in a
timely fashion.

Change-Id: I4521e37ee276b6182dd29cc02fba78861ea8d95e

DEFAULT section.

subject: Unpin beaker-rspec
revisions:
[{'created': '2015-06-08 19:55:59.000000000', 'files': ['spec/acceptance/nodesets/nodepool-trusty.yml', 'Gemfile', 'spec/acceptance/nodesets/nodepool-centos7.yml'], 'message': "Unpin beaker-rspec

The latest version of beaker tries to manage sshd_config[1] in order to
pass through environment variables. JJB also tries to manage
sshd_config by adding Match blocks to securely allow root SSH[2]. When
beaker tries to append the PermitUserEnvironment line after the Match
blocks, SSH fails to open port 22 and beaker can't SSH in to the
node[3]. This patch unpins beaker-rspec and adds set_env: false to the
nodepool nodesets so that the set_env method is never called and does
not try to mess with the sshd_config.

[1] https://github.com/puppetlabs/beaker/blob/master/lib/beaker/host_prebuilt_steps.rb#L528
[2] http://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack-infra/project-config/tree/jenkins/jobs/puppet-module-jobs.yaml#n42
[3] http://logs.openstack.org/61/185161/1/check/gate-puppet-nova-puppet-beaker-rspec-dsvm-centos7/cd81608/console.html.gz#_2015-05-22_22_05_46_933
[4] https://github.com/puppetlabs/beaker/blob/master/lib/beaker/host_prebuilt_steps.rb#L502

Change-Id: Ia96c315a44d7ae90511d515b03166cbe5a060f31
", 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Unpin beaker-rspec

The latest version of beaker tries to manage sshd_config[1] in order to
pass through environment variables. JJB also tries to manage
sshd_config by adding Match blocks to securely allow root SSH[2]. When
beaker tries to append the PermitUserEnvironment line after the Match
blocks, SSH fails to open port 22 and beaker can't SSH in to the
node[3]. This patch unpins beaker-rspec and adds set_env: false to the
nodepool nodesets so that the set_env method is never called and does
not try to mess with the sshd_config.

[1] https://github.com/puppetlabs/beaker/blob/master/lib/beaker/host_prebuilt_steps.rb#L528
[2] http://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack-infra/project-config/tree/jenkins/jobs/puppet-module-jobs.yaml#n42
[3] http://logs.openstack.org/61/185161/1/check/gate-puppet-nova-puppet-beaker-rspec-dsvm-centos7/cd81608/console.html.gz#_2015-05-22_22_05_46_933
[4] https://github.com/puppetlabs/beaker/blob/master/lib/beaker/host_prebuilt_steps.rb#L502

Change-Id: Ia96c315a44d7ae90511d515b03166cbe5a060f31

commit_message:
Add configuration options for catalog directories

Give ability to get path from a configured location instead of
a fixed location (currently 2 directories higher than location
of executed code)

This configuration is optional and if not specified, defaults
to previous behavior.

Change-Id: I56981be9f04f318ffa51594d055a120df8d88bfb

commit_message:
Better parsing in _read_host_file_leases

I just noticed this mess while reviewing [1].  I thought of a more
straight-forward approach which is to pull fields off of the front.
Let me know what you think.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/185066

Change-Id: I6ec33860512e56c7d3cdeff265b7cd2fa54704bc

commit_message:
IBP: accept removable block devices only from vendor list

fuel-agent should ignore removable block device if their vendor
isn't in approved vendor list.
It's a backport of what has been already implemented in
nailgun-agent.

Change-Id: I406eb4d9539f1be55f97dce73cf2f611941fabd4
Closes-Bug: #1462397
(cherry picked from commit 9c7b155475a0a16d248214e08127f378f2021182)

commit_message:
Further improvment of plugin base

*) Introduce meta class that allows to bind meta data to class
   Like we have for context order and hidden, for scenarios validation
   types and so on.

   In near future all plugin will use meta stuff for storing
   infomration required for: validation, types, rally-info stuff

*) Make base Plugin class subclass of MetaMixin

*) Rename plugin -> configure decorator

*) Make configure() and deprecated() work for all objects
  (not only subclasses of Plugin)

*) Add from_func decorator that makes functional look like plugin

*) Add support of plugins namespace

Change-Id: I160a0021bc0e2da9aa43e26286c4e0491340fa51

commit_message:
Added a unit test to cover diff_dicts in utils.py

The test verifies that diff_dicts returns correctly when a key is
missing in the first dictionary but is not missing in the second
dictionary.

Change-Id: I95d61cd7a890b767083a6eea7e1070c1458223bd

to Rally experimental job to enable testing Ironic benchmarks.

commit_message:
Convert Rally to the new Devstack plugin model

Switch Rally integration with Devstack to the new plugin model [1].
This allows to install Rally by one line in localrc, without
copying any files by hand. It also may make setting CI jobs easier.

[1] http://docs.openstack.org/developer/devstack/plugins.html

Change-Id: Icd35a0fc7072e7693059f2bcf3d40be76750f450

commit_message:
Use one yaml file per vendor

With an increasing numbers of vendors, having all profiles in
a single file, and with dicts inside dicts inside dicts... is
getting more complicated to have a general view of what is
available.

Change-Id: I6f386829774365125d585a6ff1b6e22f4c98df2a

commit_message:
Randomize tunnel id query to avoid contention

When networks are created rapidly, neutron-servers compete
for segmentation ids which creates too much contention and
may lead to inability to choose available id in hardcoded amount
of attempts (11)
Randomize tunnel id selection so that condition is not hit.

Change-Id: I7068f90fe4927e6e693f8a62cb704213b2da2920
Related-Bug: #1382064
Closes-Bug: #1454434
(cherry picked from commit 1d9fd2aec00cb85034e5a23cc1beac33c74e0110)

subject: Return empty str for permissive, none, properties
revisions:
[{'created': '2015-06-09 11:18:32.000000000', 'files': ['glance/tests/functional/v2/test_images.py', 'glance/tests/functional/__init__.py', 'glance/schema.py'], 'message': "Return empty str for permissive, none, properties

In Kilo, a patch landed to allow glance for returning None values. While
this was not an issue for the base and registered properties in the
`schema-image.json` file, it did break backwards compatibility for the
custom images created in V1 that have a vulue equal to None.

In order to restore compatibility, this changes returns empty strings
for those custom properties that exist in the database but that are not
part of the V2 schema. This strategy will help migrating such properties
when updates to the image data happens and it'll be a noop for just
reads.

We can't use a schema migration because we don't know off hand which of
the properties in the database are the ones that would need to be
migrated.

While we could skip this properties entirely, this patch prefers to send
the empty string back as a way to create awareness on the fact that
there's an empty property in the database. Since we didn't use to return
these properties, we can assume they weren't being used.

Closes-bug: #1419823
Change-Id: I59bb27a892fe9485fc98a612ca0148a84123f5a2
", 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Return empty str for permissive, none, properties

In Kilo, a patch landed to allow glance for returning None values. While
this was not an issue for the base and registered properties in the
`schema-image.json` file, it did break backwards compatibility for the
custom images created in V1 that have a vulue equal to None.

In order to restore compatibility, this changes returns empty strings
for those custom properties that exist in the database but that are not
part of the V2 schema. This strategy will help migrating such properties
when updates to the image data happens and it'll be a noop for just
reads.

We can't use a schema migration because we don't know off hand which of
the properties in the database are the ones that would need to be
migrated.

While we could skip this properties entirely, this patch prefers to send
the empty string back as a way to create awareness on the fact that
there's an empty property in the database. Since we didn't use to return
these properties, we can assume they weren't being used.

Closes-bug: #1419823
Change-Id: I59bb27a892fe9485fc98a612ca0148a84123f5a2

commit_message:
ovs-agent: prevent ARP requests with faked IP addresses

This patch extends the existing ARP protection to ensure
that ARP requests also have valid IP addresses.

Closes-Bug: 1456333

Change-Id: I0b2ba21611c9fd9e304bce8cfb00259db1dceaa2
(cherry picked from commit 676db821ebaf3cce5ce89f4d5d55fcbd772c079b)

revisions:
[{'created': '2015-05-29 00:36:54.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "IP Address length only needs to be 45 chars long

Currently, Neutron defines the ipallocations table's ip_address
column as String(64). IPv4 addresses are 15 chars long, while IPv6
addresses are 39. The longest IP address possible is an IPv4 mapped
IPv6 address, that is 45 characters long.

commit_message:
IP Address length only needs to be 45 chars long

Currently, Neutron defines the ipallocations table's ip_address
column as String(64). IPv4 addresses are 15 chars long, while IPv6
addresses are 39. The longest IP address possible is an IPv4 mapped
IPv6 address, that is 45 characters long.

Change-Id: Ic41386f5d3189fcd97521b50969ac2ccf85faabd
Closes-Bug: #1459880

pass through environment variables. JJB also tries to manage
sshd_config by adding Match blocks to securely allow root SSH[2]. When
beaker tries to append the PermitUserEnvironment line after the Match

node[3]. This patch unpins beaker-rspec and adds set_env: false to the

commit_message:
Unpin beaker-rspec

The latest version of beaker tries to manage sshd_config[1] in order to
pass through environment variables. JJB also tries to manage
sshd_config by adding Match blocks to securely allow root SSH[2]. When
beaker tries to append the PermitUserEnvironment line after the Match
blocks, SSH fails to open port 22 and beaker can't SSH in to the
node[3]. This patch unpins beaker-rspec and adds set_env: false to the
nodepool nodesets so that the set_env method is never called and does
not try to mess with the sshd_config.

[1] https://github.com/puppetlabs/beaker/blob/master/lib/beaker/host_prebuilt_steps.rb#L528
[2] http://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack-infra/project-config/tree/jenkins/jobs/puppet-module-jobs.yaml#n42
[3] http://logs.openstack.org/61/185161/1/check/gate-puppet-nova-puppet-beaker-rspec-dsvm-centos7/cd81608/console.html.gz#_2015-05-22_22_05_46_933
[4] https://github.com/puppetlabs/beaker/blob/master/lib/beaker/host_prebuilt_steps.rb#L502

Change-Id: Icac3bf7d5fd5dc3b4e24d6d30f76e3378a1f5820

commit_message:
Unpin beaker-rspec

The latest version of beaker tries to manage sshd_config[1] in order to
pass through environment variables. JJB also tries to manage
sshd_config by adding Match blocks to securely allow root SSH[2]. When
beaker tries to append the PermitUserEnvironment line after the Match
blocks, SSH fails to open port 22 and beaker can't SSH in to the
node[3]. This patch unpins beaker-rspec and adds set_env: false to the
nodepool nodesets so that the set_env method is never called and does
not try to mess with the sshd_config.

[1] https://github.com/puppetlabs/beaker/blob/master/lib/beaker/host_prebuilt_steps.rb#L528
[2] http://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack-infra/project-config/tree/jenkins/jobs/puppet-module-jobs.yaml#n42
[3] http://logs.openstack.org/61/185161/1/check/gate-puppet-nova-puppet-beaker-rspec-dsvm-centos7/cd81608/console.html.gz#_2015-05-22_22_05_46_933
[4] https://github.com/puppetlabs/beaker/blob/master/lib/beaker/host_prebuilt_steps.rb#L502

Change-Id: I66f40027265fabf3868398213d72e40d62880004

commit_message:
[IBP] Verify the filesystem after expanding it

Resizing filesystem is inherently dangerous operation and can fail
both due to hardware problems and software bugs. Therefore check the
filesystem after resizing it to prevent the greater damage.

While at it make sure Ubuntu FS images produced by fuel-agent can be
resized up to 8 TB.

Related-Bug: #1459665
Change-Id: Iefd4504a13a581309805b358900cb94c53f57e81
(cherry picked from commit d56597371392b3fa3198c43d3ecc4a991cc88309)

The update of the apt cookbook version currently breaks the gates for opentstack-chef-repo and openstack-block-storage, because of a dependency on the ceph cookbook, which is incompatible in its currently released version with the new apt cookbook. The fix was committed in master (https://github.com/ceph/ceph-cookbook/commit/4883a0b09232e2cc205851709b80b168e7ee5450) and we can do our apt update as soon, as this is released to the supermarket.

This reverts commit f0e7724f37516ed39eaf17adb2e3f2273347c162.

Change-Id: Ib36b58e7e25c4c24bb480fc9412d909c167f5fdd
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Revert "update the apt cookbook version".

The update of the apt cookbook version currently breaks the gates for opentstack-chef-repo and openstack-block-storage, because of a dependency on the ceph cookbook, which is incompatible in its currently released version with the new apt cookbook. The fix was committed in master (https://github.com/ceph/ceph-cookbook/commit/4883a0b09232e2cc205851709b80b168e7ee5450) and we can do our apt update as soon, as this is released to the supermarket.

This reverts commit f0e7724f37516ed39eaf17adb2e3f2273347c162.

Change-Id: Ib36b58e7e25c4c24bb480fc9412d909c167f5fdd

revisions:
[{'created': '2015-02-03 21:37:22.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Correct the legacy serialization of NUMATopology

At the end of the Juno release cycle, we pushed a bunch of code into
Nova around NUMA topology objects which had their own serialization and
object model in nova/virt/hardware.py. In the Kilo cycle, we've ported
these objects to the nova.objects framework and in doing so, we made a
number of compromises that resulted in technical debt being added to
Nova. Specifically, we kept the legacy JSON serialization format for
numa topologies stored in the Nova database and continued to send that
legacy JSON format over the wire from the scheduler to the compute
nodes.

This patch cleans up all use of the legacy JSON format and isolates it
entirely in the nova.objects.ComputeNode's _from_db_object() and
obj_load_attr() methods, transparently converting from the old legacy
format to the new nova.objects JSON format over time. Eventually, we
should be able to deprecate and drop support for the old legacy
serialization format.

Still to be fixed is the InstanceNUMATopology side of things. This patch
only solves the ComputeNode's NUMATopology object serialization.

Change-Id: I2b9c9bdfc2456bb66df06e85c1d59fbd9a50ec30

commit_message:
Correct the legacy serialization of NUMATopology

At the end of the Juno release cycle, we pushed a bunch of code into
Nova around NUMA topology objects which had their own serialization and
object model in nova/virt/hardware.py. In the Kilo cycle, we've ported
these objects to the nova.objects framework and in doing so, we made a
number of compromises that resulted in technical debt being added to
Nova. Specifically, we kept the legacy JSON serialization format for
numa topologies stored in the Nova database and continued to send that
legacy JSON format over the wire from the scheduler to the compute
nodes.

This patch cleans up all use of the legacy JSON format and isolates it
in the nova.objects.NUMATopology's _from_db_object() and the
nova.objects.ComputeNode.obj_load_attr() methods, transparently
converting from the old legacy format to the new nova.objects JSON
format over time. Eventually, we should be able to deprecate and drop
support for the old legacy serialization format.

Change-Id: I2b9c9bdfc2456bb66df06e85c1d59fbd9a50ec30

commit_message:
Add design for an object interface

We are currently butting up against the point where the functional
interface is a bit ugly. Write up a general design for an object
interface, as well as a few other design thoughts on the library.

Change-Id: Iac675860336275ea56026fcbed27338ba80ef886

commit_message:
Allow setting default config/signal transport

This change allows the Kilo heat.conf options
default_software_config_transport and default_deployment_signal_transport to
be set. This is required for operators who would prefer a different default
transort, such as Swift TempURLs.

Change-Id: I66a20f2fd6370909165093b77ef04992fb735380

subject: Fedora: work around python-ipaddress dep issue
revisions:
[{'created': '2015-06-09 13:05:25.000000000', 'files': ['elements/keystone/pre-install.d/01-keystone'], 'message': 'Fedora: work around python-ipaddress dep issue

This patch works around a broken Fedora python-cryptography
and python-ipaddress package issue which crept in this week
due to the fact that python-ipaddr and python-ipaddress
conflict with each other. This prevents python-cryptography
from installing cleanly when installed alongside other
openstack services which require python-ipaddr.

See also: https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1229295

Change-Id: Ib6dc3722b2730164149c4e2744c21e67948f6eee
Closes-bug: 1463107
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Fedora: work around python-ipaddress dep issue

This patch works around a broken Fedora python-cryptography
and python-ipaddress package issue which crept in this week
due to the fact that python-ipaddr and python-ipaddress
conflict with each other. This prevents python-cryptography
from installing cleanly when installed alongside other
openstack services which require python-ipaddr.

See also: https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1229295

Change-Id: Ib6dc3722b2730164149c4e2744c21e67948f6eee
Closes-bug: 1463107

commit_message:
Add paste_config optional parameter

This adds a optional param to set the Paste Deployment paste_config
in keystone.conf. Allows specify path to the paste configuration file
that defines the WSGI available pipelines.
Default value: /usr/share/keystone/keystone-dist-paste.ini

Change-Id: I2501ff588dcfa77177a912068506b1de917286a5
(cherry picked from commit 2abfb25c9b60bf28b46a1e1efbedc3c0b9f9150d)

commit_message:
Fix fwaas package name for Ubuntu and Debian

The name of the source package is misleading. The name of the binary
package is actually python-neutron-fwaas, not neutron-fwaas.

http://ubuntu-cloud.archive.canonical.com/ubuntu/dists/trusty-updates/kilo/main/binary-amd64/Packages
https://packages.debian.org/sid/python-neutron-fwaas

Change-Id: If03c6dbd4391f5c1a0ee540a68a9b09ec3b2a264

commit_message:
horizon-policy-abstraction spec

move specification from kilo to liberty

Abstract policy into "name", "object", "violation condition", "action"
and "data", and express this abstraction in Horizon. This abstraction
is not just a expression of datasource drivers, and it makes those
users who are not familiar with Datalog express their intent more
easily and intuitively.

modified:   horizon-policy-abstraction.rst

-Clarify the meanings of abstraction elements and give some examples
-Give an example to show how the UI looks like and how to use it

Implements: bleprint horizon-policy-abstraction
Change-Id: I4c26bcb27f3f14cd2961a6ff642d2bcfbaccca79

commit_message:
Cleanup 'scheduled_at' from instances table

The 'scheduled_at' field is a part of the Nova instances.
Currently, the 'scheduled_at' field is no longer updated
by the Nova scheduler, instead the 'launched_at' field is
updated for the same purpose. The 'scheduled_at' column is
now redundant and should be removed as a part of DB clean up.

Change-Id: I7ccf1d225c983b69c05f2415094071bdafd63b85
Blueprint: cleanup-scheduled-at

commit_message:
Switch from MySQL-python to PyMySQL

As discussed in the Liberty Design Summit "Moving apps to Python 3"
cross-project workshop, the way forward in the near future is to
switch to the pure-python PyMySQL library as a default.

https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/liberty-cross-project-python3

Change-Id: I1ef557218175c77a045c01d7efdefd99ff61e25c

commit_message:
Adding user_id handling to keypair show api call

Administrators will be able to get details a keypair which owned by users
other than themselves.

Related to blueprint admin-query-any-keypair

Change-Id: I89b4f5b6f9eac663eca5135a5091962c869b9e2f

revisions:
[{'created': '2015-06-09 00:59:03.000000000', 'files': ['barbican/api/controllers/__init__.py', 'barbican/api/app.py', 'barbican/api/hooks.py'], 'message': 'Fix NewRelic error reporting

Adding a hook to capture errors for NewRelic. Unfortunately,
the tracebacks reported to NewRelic do not completely reflect
the tracebacks in the logs. However, this issue has been
addressed in Pecan commit d3159f1d6bec06845b152de836793f4454d95804.
We just need to wait for a newer Pecan release to address that
issue.

Change-Id: I2cc542d09420bdf30afc3970f1bfec5a9300d72c
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Fix NewRelic error reporting

Adding a hook to capture errors for NewRelic. Unfortunately,
the tracebacks reported to NewRelic do not completely reflect
the tracebacks in the logs. However, this issue has been
addressed in Pecan commit d3159f1d6bec06845b152de836793f4454d95804.
We just need to wait for a newer Pecan release to address that
issue.

Change-Id: I2cc542d09420bdf30afc3970f1bfec5a9300d72c

commit_message:
Support for encrypt/decrypt parameters in heat-manage

Adding support to encrypt/decrypt parameters through heat-manage
command.

Change-Id: I2cd7b8837156ebe892d591f48ad2b1c6ecca5f9d
Implements: blueprint encrypt-hidden-parameters
Co-Authored-By: Jason Dunsmore <jasondunsmore@gmail.com>

revisions:
[{'created': '2015-05-27 22:53:45.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Fix more tests on Python 3

* dispatcher/file.py: maxBytes parameter of
  logging.handlers.RotatingFileHandler must be an integer, not None.
  Use the "or 0" hack to convert None to 0.
* Fix test_query on Python 3: ast.literal_eval("1+1") now returns 2 on
  Python 3, whereas it raises a ValueError on Python 2. Use a string
  invalid in Python 2 and Python 3 based on the original bug report
  #1221736
* test_swift: fix url_for() mock, it now returns a string for the
  endpoint
* storage.test_get_connection: skip test_three_urls_no_default()
  if the happybase module is missing (it's not compatible with Python 3
  yet)

Enable more tests on Python 3.4:

*  ceilometer.tests.api.v2.test_query
*  ceilometer.tests.dispatcher.test_db
*  ceilometer.tests.dispatcher.test_file
*  ceilometer.tests.dispatcher.test_http
*  ceilometer.tests.objectstore.test_swift
*  ceilometer.tests.storage.test_get_connection

Change-Id: I1d9bdd73bd21ec5dc8ee9823352f6dfe818b8d6b

  Python 3, whereas it raises a ValueError on Python 2. Use a string
  invalid in Python 2 and Python 3 based on the original bug report
  #1221736
* test_swift: fix url_for() mock, it now returns a string for the
  endpoint
* storage.test_get_connection: skip test_three_urls_no_default()
  if the happybase module is missing (it's not compatible with Python 3
  yet)

Enable more tests on Python 3.4:

*  ceilometer.tests.api.v2.test_query
*  ceilometer.tests.dispatcher.test_db
*  ceilometer.tests.dispatcher.test_file
*  ceilometer.tests.dispatcher.test_http
*  ceilometer.tests.objectstore.test_swift
*  ceilometer.tests.storage.test_get_connection

Change-Id: I1d9bdd73bd21ec5dc8ee9823352f6dfe818b8d6b
', 'number': 5}]
commit_message:
Fix more tests on Python 3

* Fix test_get_connection: max_bytes and backup_count parameters of the
  logging module must be int, not None.
* Fix test_query on Python 3: ast.literal_eval("1+1") now returns 2 on
  Python 3, whereas it raises a ValueError on Python 2. Use a string
  invalid in Python 2 and Python 3 based on the original bug report
  #1221736
* test_swift: fix url_for() mock, it now returns a string for the
  endpoint
* storage.test_get_connection: skip test_three_urls_no_default()
  if the happybase module is missing (it's not compatible with Python 3
  yet)

Enable more tests on Python 3.4:

*  ceilometer.tests.api.v2.test_query
*  ceilometer.tests.dispatcher.test_db
*  ceilometer.tests.dispatcher.test_file
*  ceilometer.tests.dispatcher.test_http
*  ceilometer.tests.objectstore.test_swift
*  ceilometer.tests.storage.test_get_connection

Change-Id: I1d9bdd73bd21ec5dc8ee9823352f6dfe818b8d6b

commit_message:
Add validate_array to NFS server list

the value of nfs_shares parameter to ensure it is a valid array before
writing its content into the file referred to by the nfs_shares_config
option.

commit_message:
[IT] supports EDP tests without Swift storage

Add input data source on HDFS to enable EDP tests without Swift storage.
If config "SKIP_SWIFT_TEST" is true, EDP tests use input data on HDFS.

Change-Id: I50faa1c6838333aedfd6972c60210b4a0402add9
Closes-Bug: 1309534

commit_message:
Add configuration helpers for Quobyte

The Quobyte system is conceptionally similar to GlusterFS, which is why
their Cinder driver is forked from the GlusterFS Cinder driver, so I
have taken the same approach here.

Change-Id: I5f207a2ca18bc039ad9d4a6036cec4ad84d5d5f5
(cherry picked from commit 1a4841b535155eab1c5d9425718a5563347e22bb)

commit_message:
Adding augeas insertion check.
Augeas change call will fail if key does not exists in policy.json.
This fix will add the key/value if it doesn't exists or will change the
value to match.
Added unit test.
Change-Id: Ibd97228c431fa6b23e8a15ce548f82f649131cc2
(cherry picked from commit db6ef26eb04c559d7452b8d5d81ab9530776b929)

subject: Adding Publisher Acknowledgements/confirms
revisions:
[{'created': '2015-06-09 11:53:20.000000000', 'files': ['oslo_messaging/tests/drivers/test_impl_rabbit.py', 'oslo_messaging/_drivers/impl_rabbit.py'], 'message': 'Adding Publisher Acknowledgements/confirms

During the vancouver summit, Michael Klishin from
pivotal proposed we should use publisher confirms
as the default setting to reduce messages being
dropped on the floor.

https://www.rabbitmq.com/confirms.html
http://www.rabbitmq.com/blog/2011/02/10/introducing-publisher-confirms/

This setting is a lightweight way of keeping track of which messages
have been processed by the broker and which would need re-publishing
in case of broker shutdown or network failure.

Change-Id: I25bc955df130dad4725f5281211d37fd73e7ea63
(cherry picked from commit cd63a7023519b82a46b3f29f2691ff32c5085c9f)
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Adding Publisher Acknowledgements/confirms

During the vancouver summit, Michael Klishin from
pivotal proposed we should use publisher confirms
as the default setting to reduce messages being
dropped on the floor.

https://www.rabbitmq.com/confirms.html
http://www.rabbitmq.com/blog/2011/02/10/introducing-publisher-confirms/

This setting is a lightweight way of keeping track of which messages
have been processed by the broker and which would need re-publishing
in case of broker shutdown or network failure.

Change-Id: I25bc955df130dad4725f5281211d37fd73e7ea63
(cherry picked from commit cd63a7023519b82a46b3f29f2691ff32c5085c9f)

commit_message:
Fix host server assignment for resources with multi-node dependency

An additional check was introduced for determining the host node to
verify the type of relationship, and assign a node as host only if
a 'tosca.relationships.HostedOn' relationship exists between the
two nodes. A test case is also added.

Change-Id: Iec5d0f70b092dd2a09c514e0f28e638abdb25997
Closes-Bug: #1455263

subject: My First ABAC: An example alternative assignment engine
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 2218, 'name': 'Adam Young', 'email': 'adam@younglogic.com', 'username': 'ayoung'}, {'_account_id': 2903, 'name': 'Morgan Fainberg', 'email': 'morgan.fainberg@gmail.com', 'username': 'mdrnstm'}, {'_account_id': 5707, 'name': 'henry-nash', 'email': 'henry.nash@uk.ibm.com', 'username': 'henry-nash'}, {'_account_id': 6482, 'name': 'Steve Martinelli', 'email': 's.martinelli@gmail.com', 'username': 'stevemar'}, {'_account_id': 9751, 'name': 'IBM DB2 CI', 'email': 'scecd@cn.ibm.com', 'username': 'ibmdb2', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 11022, 'name': 'Rodrigo Duarte Sousa', 'email': 'rodrigodsousa@gmail.com', 'username': 'rodrigods'}, {'_account_id': 12893, 'name': 'TAHMINA AHMED', 'email': 'tahmina.csebuet@gmail.com', 'username': 'tahmina-csebuet'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2014-12-22 22:51:43.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'My First ABAC: An example alternative assignments engine

One of the goals of the assignment split was to allow alternate
assignment engines to be provided. One the sticking points in
the discussion about whether role management should be done in
its own backend (within the assignment umbrella) is how that
would affect an alternate assignment engine.

This example provides a simple, non-generalized ABAC engine that
replaces the current assignment model, showing how such an
alternate engine can use the cleaner split of the new assignments
component.

Although written as a contrib extensions, this doesn't belong
here - and should be a good example of an "out-of-tree" addon
to Keystone.  As can be seen, we have work to do to make such
out-of-tree deevlopment possible.

This should not be merged, but is provided for discussion.
Although it provides its own tests that shows it works, it cannot
currently pass the standard unit tests since there is no easy
way for us to turn off the testing of the current assigment API
(which this extension replaces).

Change-Id: I0dbe3dd46b6a310227ca5d779b35f232b97ac848
', 'number': 1}, {'created': '2014-12-22 23:21:32.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'My First ABAC: An example alternative assignments engine

One of the goals of the assignment split was to allow alternate
assignment engines to be provided. One the sticking points in
the discussion about whether role management should be done in
its own backend (within the assignment umbrella) is how that
would affect an alternate assignment engine.

This example provides a simple, non-generalized ABAC engine that
replaces the current assignment model, showing how such an
alternate engine can use the cleaner split of the new assignments
component. The key file to look at in this regard is:

keystone.contrib.myfirstabac.backends.sql

which replaces the existing assignment driver, provding both
the methods needed so that the rest of Keystone and OpenStack
can function, as well as the new methods of the simple ABAC API.

Although written as a contrib extensions, it doesn't belong
there - and should be a good example of an "out-of-tree" add-on
to Keystone.  As can be seen, we have work to do to make such
out-of-tree deevlopment possible.

This should not be merged, but is provided for discussion.
Although it provides its own tests that shows it works, it cannot
currently pass the standard unit tests since there is no easy
way for us to turn off the testing of the current assigment API
(which this extension replaces).

commit_message:
My First ABAC: An example alternative assignment engine

One of the goals of the assignment split was to allow alternate
assignment engines to be provided. One of the sticking points in
the discussion about whether role management should be done in
its own backend (within the assignment umbrella) is how that
would affect an alternate assignment engine.

This example provides a simple, non-generalized ABAC engine that
replaces the current assignment model, showing how such an
alternate engine can use the cleaner split of the new assignments
component. The key file to look at in this regard is:

keystone.contrib.myfirstabac.backends.sql

...which replaces the existing assignment driver, provding both
the methods needed so that the rest of Keystone and OpenStack
can function, as well as the new methods of the simple ABAC API.
From this we can see how the new split allows just the
functionality required to be included in the new driver.

Although written as a contrib extensions, it doesn't belong
there - and should be a good example of an "out-of-tree" add-on
to Keystone.  As can be seen, we have work to do to make such
out-of-tree deevlopment possible.

This should not be merged, but is provided for discussion.
Although it provides its own tests that shows it works, it cannot
currently pass the standard unit tests since there is no easy
way for us to turn off the testing of the current assigment API
(which this extension replaces).

Change-Id: I0dbe3dd46b6a310227ca5d779b35f232b97ac848

commit_message:
Validation of user parameter

Created a schema for parameters during user creation
and user update and validated incoming parameters.
Changed tests for valid email ids.

bp create-user-validation

commit_message:
Self Management of Roles and Domain Scoped Roles

This specifies an API to allow federated users to self-register to
join domain based groups which can then be assigned to roles or domain based
roles in the normal way.

Change-Id: I1232c3dbcc6bcc4195ec3dd6e32c7a7cbc29c255
Co-authored-by: Ioram Sette <iss@cin.ufpe.br>

commit_message:
Trusted Attributes Policy for External Identity Providers

Proposes a feature to add fine grained control over which
attributes (both types and values) Keystone will accept as
trustworthy from an external identity provider. All attributes
(types and/or values) that are not trusted should be
discarded by federated Keystone.

Change-Id: I4d2b1a3aa8bbb3cd8d3c76e8ec4c2b6c023db0b3
Co-Authored-By: Ioram Sette <iss@cin.ufpe.br>

revisions:
[{'created': '2015-06-04 01:00:13.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Trigger tox from package.json, if necessary.

This patch adds several fixes to improve karma test handling.

* A postinstall hook was added to package.json, which tests for
  the existence of .venv. If it is not found, it will invoke
  tox -e py27 --notest.
* Both karma.conf files were taught to automatically detect the
  directories in which the xstatic dependencies might live, and
  pick the appropriate directory.

postinstall was chosen, because setting up a virtual environment
is likely to be useful for more than one type of npm job.

Change-Id: I822cb020bd8b2ca8d4f994b9734af5636e4bd144

commit_message:
Trigger tox from package.json, if necessary.

This patch adds several fixes to improve karma test handling.

* A postinstall hook was added to package.json, which tests for
  the existence of .venv. If it is not found, it will invoke
  tox -e py27 --notest.
* Both karma.conf files were taught to automatically detect the
  directories in which the xstatic dependencies might live, and
  pick the appropriate directory.

postinstall was chosen, because setting up a virtual environment
is likely to be useful for more than one type of npm job.

Add support for shared volumes between guests

This blueprint proposes a change to Nova to support
attaching a cinder volume to more than one instance.

Blueprint: blueprint multi_attach_volume

commit_message:
User-password-update accepts blank as password

Initially "keystone user-password-update username"
command worked successfully even if the user left
the new password as blank. But the issue was that
the user then was not able to log in with a blank
password and not even with his old password.

Updated the code to raise an error if the user tries
to keep his password as blank.

Closes-Bug: #1391116

Change-Id: Ie170418905930ee8449562e9eb0a6fec4553ea0c

commit_message:
Correct password parameter for glance::api

The testing keystone password was set to 'a_big_secret' throughout the
test manifest except for in the glance-api class, so the
glance-api.conf would have the wrong password and tests for
glance_image would fail. This patch sets the password to be consistent
across the manifest.

Change-Id: I8b781d3080b2dd5e894c84a23c892e4f153d8aa6

commit_message:

This will ensure strict Abstract Meta Classes when extending or inheriting the
BaseProvider from the token provider API.

commit_message:
Bring Redhat support to acceptance tests

OpenStack Infra has jobs to run this on both Ubuntu Trusty and CentOS7.

* Add minitest to Gemfile (dependency to run beaker on centos - see 11
  http://projects.theforeman.org/issues/2650 for details)
* separate nodepool files to have trusty & centos7 support in OS infra
* class_spec: add case for repo configuration and support
  RH systems.
* don't install rabbitmq module that is not used (yet)
* install the apt module explicitly since it's no longer installed
  implicitly by the rabbitmq module

Change-Id: I17a571c8d56d55337ee0c8491fb4aad272074cf6
Closes-bug: #1444736

revisions:
[{'created': '2015-06-04 20:59:21.000000000', 'files': ['manifests/init.pp', 'spec/classes/cinder_spec.rb'], 'message': 'fixed behavior for rabbit_hosts variable

We identified an issue where if a user had previously defined rabbit_host,
then went to rabbit_hosts, the old value would cause confusion in many
of the OpenStack tools. This patch ensures that when rabbit_hosts is
defined, rabbit_host is absent, to avoid any configuration problems.

Change-Id: I8b5c497d2bb4f3e637aff0dd7cf61f91f173027c
(cherry picked from commit b038d2350d55e98d1df3a0957ab75919c47d6a42)
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
fixed behavior for rabbit_hosts variable

We identified an issue where if a user had previously defined rabbit_host,
then went to rabbit_hosts, the old value would cause confusion in many
of the OpenStack tools. This patch ensures that when rabbit_hosts is
defined, rabbit_host is absent, to avoid any configuration problems.

Change-Id: I8b5c497d2bb4f3e637aff0dd7cf61f91f173027c
(cherry picked from commit b038d2350d55e98d1df3a0957ab75919c47d6a42)

commit_message:
crontab: ensure nova-common is installed before

Because we create a crontab with 'nova' user, we need to ensure it
exists. So we need to make sure Nova is installed (common package).

Otherwise, it can lead to dependencies issues.

Change-Id: I5157e710e4f2e95c4ec9c1f45b414e4a3dbf9228
(cherry picked from commit 54802658adb87719ff5be7f8856e1da9cf5e4144)

description and links for more information to the user.

to move forward in disagregating the tests for a more stable
OpenStack.

I am sure this is rough in wording, as my english skills are currently
exhausted for the day, however it is hopefully a reasonable stab to
get this ball rolling.

Change-Id: I7a3663a93e9ea0c9adfb443221c2025edb331644
', 'number': 1}, {'created': '2015-02-09 13:54:19.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Testing guidelines

and philosophy moving forward to provide a more stable OpenStack

commit_message:
Testing guidelines

A guide to the history of testing in OpenStack, things we've learned,
and philosophy moving forward to provide a more stable OpenStack
experience for all users of all projects.

Change-Id: I7a3663a93e9ea0c9adfb443221c2025edb331644

commit_message:
Add MidoNet plugin manifest

Define the resources to configure MidoNet plugin with Neutron. Is worth
say that, since MidoNet plugin is not in official repos, this manifest
does not install the packages and delegates to an orchestration tool or
a wrapper manifest to do so.

Is is planned to add package declaration after Kilo release.

Change-Id: Ib5f73729f314a40197b4d1c75ec33fd246df83d9
(cherry picked from commit 5e034e2af7ecb31cfcb758c7f43f47e46ce5677a)

commit_message:
Added parameters for availability zones configuration

For configuration availability zones for nova-compute
the corresponding options have been added.
For details see table Table 2.16 in
http://docs.openstack.org/juno/config-reference/content/list-of-compute-config-options.html

Change-Id: I284ebd9db3b5b7c5e9218621b516cf045e5d1375
(cherry picked from commit 47a029ced063292bd9a088e93b3a69b7a1185110)

revisions:
[{'created': '2015-03-18 21:11:13.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/fixtures.py'], 'message': 'wip: in tree add of EnhancedFakeLogger

For nova functional tests we need to make our logs look like
production logs, including the context information. Both to keep track
of the contexts in question, as well as to see when requests are
processing in parallel.

There is an upstream pull request to put this into fixtures proper:
https://github.com/testing-cabal/fixtures/pull/5 however until that
lands it would be nice to move forward on local testing.

Change-Id: I4e28595821cd14e6728068b434c72940e9e56e21
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
wip: in tree add of EnhancedFakeLogger

For nova functional tests we need to make our logs look like
production logs, including the context information. Both to keep track
of the contexts in question, as well as to see when requests are
processing in parallel.

There is an upstream pull request to put this into fixtures proper:
https://github.com/testing-cabal/fixtures/pull/5 however until that
lands it would be nice to move forward on local testing.

commit_message:
Modify the policy file

Modify the policy in etc/policy.json to a new one that provide the cloud
administrator with more roles for better control.

Change-Id: Ice6766f6cfaec2d0f94baee5cf93a463c9bea2d5

commit_message:
Use ConfigFilter for auth_token options

ConfigFilter provides a way to isolate your config options so that they
are protected from other code accessing those options. This will stop
people from relying upon our deprecated options.

ConfigFilter is available since oslo.config 1.4.0.0a2

Change-Id: Ib5b5f0d1bc4be90ff1883080ce38ce7ce601c547

commit_message:
Add $notification_driver parameter to notify::rabbitmq

It makes possible to control the value of notification_driver setting and defaults
to 'messaging' to maintain backwards compatibility.

Change-Id: I3f2c29adbfb605ef288962f72ba81c11811cb357
(cherry picked from commit 9be4c24d98176304a823d14817b74faef02310f4)

commit_message:
Fix Keystone domain class

Currently ::heat::keystone::domain works only if keystonerc_admin
is sourced because of missing OS_TENANT_NAME env given to script
heat-keystone-setup-domain. This patch fixes this issue.

Change-Id: Idf5d35df2c39fe724350a00437b76be3333194c2
(cherry picked from commit c280fa550114744adb0b572982c0820ace9b207b)

commit_message:
Remove deprecated group name of option

Option detach_volume_timeout was replaced to timeouts section
in Kilo release. Now we can remove deprecated group name for that
option.

Change-Id: Ic1c709b70a42aef12b8341b6018972343d2df363

commit_message:
Separate app object and router object

Currently global 'app' object is based on Backbone.Router and
tightly coupled with it.

Related to blueprint react-router

Change-Id: Ib4575687bbc17e2515132db453648cbf24c46f17

revisions:
[{'created': '2015-05-29 20:17:03.000000000', 'files': ['sahara/api/v11.py', 'etc/sahara/policy.json', 'sahara/tests/unit/api/test_acl.py', 'sahara/api/v10.py'], 'message': 'Making policy namespaces more unique

This adds "data-processing:" to the beginning of all namespaces for
sahara's policy based actions. This will help ensure that we minimize
the possibility for name collisions in unified policy files.

* change policy names in policy.json
* change policy names in v10 and v11 api functions
* change policy tests to reflect newer names (not strictly necessary but
  added for consistency)

Change-Id: Ieef8c8de25764197a2ed59ba9f71c37fc62a75ca
Closes-Bug: 1460196
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Making policy namespaces more unique

This adds "data-processing:" to the beginning of all namespaces for
sahara's policy based actions. This will help ensure that we minimize
the possibility for name collisions in unified policy files.

* change policy names in policy.json
* change policy names in v10 and v11 api functions
* change policy tests to reflect newer names (not strictly necessary but
  added for consistency)

Change-Id: Ieef8c8de25764197a2ed59ba9f71c37fc62a75ca
Closes-Bug: 1460196

revisions:
[{'created': '2015-04-15 10:36:16.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Move cluster deletion to common engine module

Suppose we have following scenario. I created cluster with
direct engine, after that I switched to Heat engine and removed
cluster. After that, cluster will be removed from Sahara DB,
but instances will be alive. This patch propose to add following:
if we try to delete direct-engine-created cluster with heat engine,
we will try to delete cluster in same way, like direct engine do it.

Related blueprint: deprecate-direct-engine

Change-Id: I65e22a8090560763547960213859b54b30f37f7e

commit_message:
Move cluster deletion to common engine module

Suppose we have following scenario. I created cluster with
direct engine, after that I switched to Heat engine and removed
cluster. After that, cluster will be removed from Sahara DB,
but instances will be alive. This patch propose to add following:
if we try to delete direct-engine-created cluster with heat engine,
we will try to delete cluster in same way, like direct engine do it.

Related blueprint: deprecate-direct-engine

Change-Id: I65e22a8090560763547960213859b54b30f37f7e

commit_message:
Modifying Swift Paths for EDP Examples

To make things more convenient for users of the JSON EDP examples,
doc and JSON payloads have been modified to use the same tree structure
as the edp-examples themselves, allowing one upload to Swift.

Change-Id: I114a6e93cb0194eab72edb065e712b9976c6b60e

Currently, when boot from volume, the block device allocate may timeout
, then the VM will set ERROR, but volume would be available later. And
the volume won't be deleted automatically by deleting the VM. Actually,
the volume is useless and should be removed.

This patch remove the corresponding volume when block device allocation
timeout.

Closes-Bug: #1447884

commit_message:
Remove useless volume when boot from volume failed

Currently, when boot instance from block device, user can choose three
kinds of sources: (blank, snapshot or image), and compute manager will
create a volume from one of them. But the volume creation may fail or
timeout at this time, then the process of instance boot will fail.

During cleanup, the failed volume cannot be deleted, and becomes unusable.

This patch removes the corresponding volume when block device allocation
fails or times out.

Closes-Bug: #1447884

Change-Id: Ib3c915b5b5920c8289d5fc69cde4a3c485ed8600

Change-Id: Icba53336556295722c3f8b7345e6cd09d8ccfed9
', 'number': 7}, {'created': '2013-01-29 05:47:13.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Libvirt: Add support for live snapshots

blueprint libvirt-live-snapshots

Implements support for live snapshots when QEMU 1.3 and Libvirt
1.0.0 are available. This implementation may function with other
hypervisors, at which point _check_use_live_snapshots can be
adjusted accordingly.

At a high level, the process is as follows. First we create a
destination file for the snapshot. This file uses the same backing
file as the origin disk and is of the same virtual size. We do this
since the combination of blockRebase and "shallow" copies are the
only bug-free method available as of QEMU 1.3 (Vish has submitted
patches upstream). This process ultimately produces a CoW file,
representing only the current delta between the root disk and
backing file. The final step converts the CoW delta to a backless
image matching the format of the origin disk.

Flags: DocImpact
Change-Id: Icba53336556295722c3f8b7345e6cd09d8ccfed9
', 'number': 8}, {'created': '2013-01-29 17:19:42.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Libvirt: Add support for live snapshots

blueprint libvirt-live-snapshots

Implements support for live snapshots when QEMU 1.3 and Libvirt
1.0.0 are available. This implementation may function with other
hypervisors, at which point _check_use_live_snapshots can be
adjusted accordingly.

At a high level, the process is as follows. First we create a
destination file for the snapshot. This file uses the same backing
file as the origin disk and is of the same virtual size. We do this
since the combination of blockRebase and "shallow" copies are the
only bug-free method available as of QEMU 1.3 (Vish has submitted
patches upstream). This process ultimately produces a CoW file,
representing only the current delta between the root disk and
backing file. The final step converts the CoW delta to a backless
image matching the format of the origin disk.

Flags: DocImpact
Change-Id: Icba53336556295722c3f8b7345e6cd09d8ccfed9

commit_message:
Libvirt: Add support for live snapshots

blueprint libvirt-live-snapshots

Implements support for live snapshots when QEMU 1.3 and Libvirt
1.0.0 are available. This implementation may function with other
hypervisors, at which point _check_use_live_snapshots can be
adjusted accordingly.

At a high level, the process is as follows. First we create a
destination file for the snapshot. This file uses the same backing
file as the origin disk and is of the same virtual size. We do this
since the combination of blockRebase and "shallow" copies are the
only bug-free method available as of QEMU 1.3 (Vish has submitted
patches upstream). This process ultimately produces a CoW file,
representing only the current delta between the root disk and
backing file. The final step converts the CoW delta to a backless
image matching the format of the origin disk.

Flags: DocImpact
Change-Id: Icba53336556295722c3f8b7345e6cd09d8ccfed9

subject: rabbit: Set timeout on the underlying socket
revisions:
[{'created': '2015-06-04 20:00:24.000000000', 'files': ['oslo_messaging/_drivers/impl_rabbit.py'], 'message': "rabbit: Set timeout on the underlying socket

--
NOTE(mriedem): This is two commits squashed to address a problem with
the rabbitmq heartbeat patch in stable/kilo (since oslo.messaging 1.8.1).
--

rabbit: Remove unused stuffs from publisher

The publisher code is over engineered, it allows to override
everything, but this is never used.

None of the child Class have the same signature, sometimes
the constructor use the parameter name as the parent class but for
a different purpose, that make the code hard to read.

It's was never clear which options is passed to the queue and the
exchange at this end to kombu.

This changes removes all of that stuffs, and only use the kombu
terminology for publisher parameters.

(cherry picked from commit cca84f66d49114ce4ae85af4bbf03a14bda79121)

--------------------------------------------

rabbit: Set timeout on the underlying socket

They are some case where the underlying can be stuck
until the system socket timeout is reached, but in oslo.messaging
we very often known that is not needed to wait for ever because
the upper layer (usualy the application) expect to return after
a certain period.

So this change set the timeout on the underlying socket each we can
determine that is not needed to wait more.

Closes-bug: #1436788
Change-Id: Ie71ab8147c56eaf672585da107bec8b22af9da6c
(cherry picked from commit 77f952a1f7d87c35fb5d7eb7e052c5b9def59b22)
", 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
rabbit: Set timeout on the underlying socket

--
NOTE(mriedem): This is two commits squashed to address a problem with
the rabbitmq heartbeat patch in stable/kilo (since oslo.messaging 1.8.1).
--

rabbit: Remove unused stuffs from publisher

The publisher code is over engineered, it allows to override
everything, but this is never used.

None of the child Class have the same signature, sometimes
the constructor use the parameter name as the parent class but for
a different purpose, that make the code hard to read.

It's was never clear which options is passed to the queue and the
exchange at this end to kombu.

This changes removes all of that stuffs, and only use the kombu
terminology for publisher parameters.

(cherry picked from commit cca84f66d49114ce4ae85af4bbf03a14bda79121)

--------------------------------------------

rabbit: Set timeout on the underlying socket

They are some case where the underlying can be stuck
until the system socket timeout is reached, but in oslo.messaging
we very often known that is not needed to wait for ever because
the upper layer (usualy the application) expect to return after
a certain period.

So this change set the timeout on the underlying socket each we can
determine that is not needed to wait more.

Closes-bug: #1436788
Change-Id: Ie71ab8147c56eaf672585da107bec8b22af9da6c
(cherry picked from commit 77f952a1f7d87c35fb5d7eb7e052c5b9def59b22)

commit_message:
consumer connections not closed properly

heartbeat_thread is not set for listeners. when closing connection,
it blindly checks heartbeat_thread and will throw an error causing
connection to remain open. this patch explicitly sets
heartbeat_thread to None.

Change-Id: Ief3bf02f952882ecadf742cdd0bac8edd7812473
Closes-Bug: #1458917

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 3009, 'name': 'Vladimir Kozhukalov', 'email': 'kozhukalov@gmail.com', 'username': 'kozhukalov'}, {'_account_id': 8003, 'name': 'Aleksandr Gordeev', 'email': 'agordeev@mirantis.com', 'username': 'agordeev'}, {'_account_id': 8789, 'name': 'Dmitry Pyzhov', 'email': 'dpyzhov+gerrit@mirantis.com', 'username': 'dpyzhov'}, {'_account_id': 8971, 'name': 'Fuel CI', 'username': 'fuel-ci', 'inactive': True, 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 10391, 'name': 'Ihor Kalnytskyi', 'email': 'ihor@kalnytskyi.com', 'username': 'ikalnitsky'}, {'_account_id': 11090, 'name': 'Sergii Golovatiuk', 'email': 'sgolovat@redhat.com', 'username': 'holser'}, {'_account_id': 13194, 'name': 'Alexei Sheplyakov', 'email': 'asheplyakov@mirantis.com', 'username': 'asheplyakov'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2015-06-08 09:44:02.000000000', 'files': ['image/centos/centos.ks'], 'message': 'image/centos: generate an image resizable to common HD sizes

At the moment the (CentOS) root filesystem image shipped with the ISO
can be resized at most to 1324 GB which might be too small given
the sizes of the modern hard drives. Make sure the image can be resized
to 8TB.

The gory details: ext4 reserves some blocks for filesystem metadata
(block group descriptors) which are used for growing the filesystem.
The number of reserved blocks determines how large the filesystem can
possilby grow. For smaller filesystems too few blocks gets reserved.
As a work around use a slightly bigger initial filesystem so it can
be expanded up to 8 TB.

It should be noted that expanding a few GB sized filesystem to several
TBs produces very suboptimal metadata layout and incurs substantial
performance degradation (15 -- 25%). Also resizing takes much longer
than unpacking a tarball (with the same content). So a proper fix is
rewriting IBP code to use a better backup/restore mechanism (which
is essentially what IBP does).

Related-Bug: #1459665
Change-Id: I07f2233d0db68be1c72307f85a99eddaf54c9346
(cherry picked from commit 5b898d26d20c3d629ee4f4dade6eec4119ca605c)
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
image/centos: generate an image resizable to common HD sizes

At the moment the (CentOS) root filesystem image shipped with the ISO
can be resized at most to 1324 GB which might be too small given
the sizes of the modern hard drives. Make sure the image can be resized
to 8TB.

The gory details: ext4 reserves some blocks for filesystem metadata
(block group descriptors) which are used for growing the filesystem.
The number of reserved blocks determines how large the filesystem can
possilby grow. For smaller filesystems too few blocks gets reserved.
As a work around use a slightly bigger initial filesystem so it can
be expanded up to 8 TB.

It should be noted that expanding a few GB sized filesystem to several
TBs produces very suboptimal metadata layout and incurs substantial
performance degradation (15 -- 25%). Also resizing takes much longer
than unpacking a tarball (with the same content). So a proper fix is
rewriting IBP code to use a better backup/restore mechanism (which
is essentially what IBP does).

Related-Bug: #1459665
Change-Id: I07f2233d0db68be1c72307f85a99eddaf54c9346
(cherry picked from commit 5b898d26d20c3d629ee4f4dade6eec4119ca605c)

commit_message:
Use netboot installer from trusty-updates

It makes sense to use a netboot installer from trusty-updates repo,
not from trusty, because it provides more fixes and updates. Moreover,
the `fuel-createmirror` downloads exactly netboot installer from
trusty-updates and ignores trusty's one. That basically means that
currently classic provisioning doesn't work with partial mirrors at all
an this commit is going to fix that.

Closes-Bug: #1461927

Change-Id: I265b212bcd7aae9b8f6764806da65b8cb98312b9
Signed-off-by: Igor Kalnitsky <igor@kalnitsky.org>

subject: Fix ipv6 support
revisions:
[{'created': '2015-06-02 02:09:14.000000000', 'files': ['lib/puppet/provider/heat_domain_id_setter/ruby.rb'], 'message': "Fix ipv6 support

There is issue with ipv6 where address has to be in brackets, this causes the
underlying ruby TCPSocket to fail. Net::HTTP.new will fail without brackets on
joining the ipv6 address with :port or passing brackets to TCPSocket. It was
found that if we use Net::HTTP.start with url.hostname the incriminated code
won't be hit.

Change-Id: Ia70e05098b52121d12b035bdab59685b086523db
Closes-Bug: rhbz#1185652
(cherry picked from commit 2331ba06e364736e3e9968dc6e927defe9c4a931)
", 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Fix ipv6 support

There is issue with ipv6 where address has to be in brackets, this causes the
underlying ruby TCPSocket to fail. Net::HTTP.new will fail without brackets on
joining the ipv6 address with :port or passing brackets to TCPSocket. It was
found that if we use Net::HTTP.start with url.hostname the incriminated code
won't be hit.

Change-Id: Ia70e05098b52121d12b035bdab59685b086523db

commit_message:
Stop unconditionally installing redhat-lsb

The installation of redhat-lsb (which installs tools and libraries, most
of them possibly unrelated to the actual Sahara plugins) has been
introduced when adding support for CentOS images.

Now the proper 'centos' element is used, so CentOS images already get
redhat-lsb-core installed. In addition to that, some image plugins
install redhat-lsb on their own, hence making the manual addition
redundant.

Change-Id: I2f3910fe3667fd29281197b6dea02023976d916c

subject: Rename resource instance variable
revisions:
[{'created': '2015-06-02 01:48:01.000000000', 'files': ['lib/puppet/provider/keystone_service/openstack.rb', 'lib/puppet/provider/keystone_endpoint/openstack.rb', 'lib/puppet/provider/keystone_user/openstack.rb', 'lib/puppet/provider/keystone_role/openstack.rb', 'lib/puppet/provider/keystone_tenant/openstack.rb'], 'message': 'Rename resource instance variable

Currently, the method instance() returns a single instance of the
resource in question for keystone_user, keystone_tenant, etc. It caches
the result in a variable called @instances. This is a confusingly named
variable since it only holds one instance. This patch simply changes
the name of the variable. It should not have any effect on any
functionality as nothing else uses the variable.

The keystone_user_role resource will implement caching differently [1]
so this change is unnecessary for that resource.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/150200/

Change-Id: I21dc22876f47d99108aaf5e90e514682ee125140
(cherry picked from commit 2287a350c731444f07f82ca6854ee9616c2de190)
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Rename resource instance variable

Currently, the method instance() returns a single instance of the
resource in question for keystone_user, keystone_tenant, etc. It caches
the result in a variable called @instances. This is a confusingly named
variable since it only holds one instance. This patch simply changes
the name of the variable. It should not have any effect on any
functionality as nothing else uses the variable.

The keystone_user_role resource will implement caching differently [1]
so this change is unnecessary for that resource.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/150200/

Change-Id: I21dc22876f47d99108aaf5e90e514682ee125140
(cherry picked from commit 2287a350c731444f07f82ca6854ee9616c2de190)

commit_message:
packages/deb: suppress starting services in the chroot

debootstrap removes /usr/sbin/policy-rc.d, so it should be created
once more. Prevents failures like
http://jenkins-product.srt.mirantis.net:8080/view/custom_iso/job/custom_6.1_iso/1285/consoleText

Closes-Bug: #1459612
Change-Id: Id0f38da26e419a6bb4ca3f9749c71563d4023c8d

Currently v2 and v2.1 have separate functional tests and their
corresponding sample files. As v2 and v2.1 are supposed to be identical,
there is overhead to maintain two set of functional tests and sample files.
We can have one set of tests which can run for both v2 and v2.1.

This commit merges console_auth_tokens functional tests.

commit_message:
Merge console_auth_tokens tests between v2 and v2.1

Currently v2 and v2.1 have separate functional tests and their
corresponding sample files. As v2 and v2.1 are supposed to be identical,
there is overhead to maintain two set of functional tests and sample files.
We can have one set of tests which can run for both v2 and v2.1.

This commit merges console_auth_tokens functional tests.

In V2.1 os-access-ip is separate plugin where in v2 it was mixed in server
plugin itself. So os-access-ip extension is enabled to run
merged functional tests for both v2 and v2.1.

commit_message:
Use timeout varibale for assert_task_success

In huge_environments test we set bigger timeout variable for
    deploy_cluster_wait but don't set when invoke assert_task_success
    method. Because of this behavior assert_task_success uses default
    timeout 7800 sec

Change-Id: I97ea23601f9acf3060b9b59bbd95c96e9aa4cc4b
Closes-bug: #1449596

commit_message:
Add in further token validation in v3_auth tests

Add in extra unscoped token validation tests that verify that the
validate of the token is infact issuing a 404. These additions
were originally part of the Fernet testing changes, but were
extracted to stand on their own as they are adding further test
functionality that is not directly applicable to fernet.

Co-Authored-By: Samuel de Medeiros Queiroz <samuel@lsd.ufcg.edu.br>

Change-Id: I683f988f6ff3e5e3f5acc5e8565403f72127c88f

commit_message:
Make second level of Rabbit OCF monitor only at slaves

W/o this fix, monitor check level 30 is not always
added into the CIB for RabbitMQ pacemaker resource.

The w/a is to define second monitor only for slaves.

Closes-bug: #1462899

Change-Id: I678b4af19e846a2a7f6c4ce829a1a8b5a4391876
Signed-off-by: Bogdan Dobrelya <bdobrelia@mirantis.com>

commit_message:
Fix agents update parameter name

According to Ken'ichi Ohmichi's TODO comment,
The parameter in nova/api/openstack/compute/plugins/v3/agents.py
function: update, name "para" is different from the ones of the
other APIs. Most other names are resource names like "server" etc.
This name should be changed to "agent" for consistent naming.

Change-Id: Ib0125d3c3079a772337d240a5414860de3d1ca3e
Closes-Bug:1458286

revisions:
[{'created': '2015-06-08 14:59:59.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/tests/base.py'], 'message': "tests: don't allow oslo.config to autodiscover config files

oslo.config makes attempts to autodiscover configuration files using
find_config_files() helper. If e.g. /etc/neutron/neutron.conf exists,
and is not readable, the following test failure can be experienced:

oslo_config.cfg.ConfigFilesPermissionDeniedError: Failed to open some
config files: /etc/neutron/neutron.conf

Unit tests must not rely on any external state of the system and run
successfully no matter whether neutron is actually installed on the
system, or not.

Closes-Bug: #1442543
Change-Id: Ic90d8c40b2072fdda152703b84081719936b5f4e
(cherry picked from commit 54fc39308277d4aedc3e399286714d719ecacfbb)
", 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
tests: don't allow oslo.config to autodiscover config files

oslo.config makes attempts to autodiscover configuration files using
find_config_files() helper. If e.g. /etc/neutron/neutron.conf exists,
and is not readable, the following test failure can be experienced:

oslo_config.cfg.ConfigFilesPermissionDeniedError: Failed to open some
config files: /etc/neutron/neutron.conf

Unit tests must not rely on any external state of the system and run
successfully no matter whether neutron is actually installed on the
system, or not.

Closes-Bug: #1442543
Change-Id: Ic90d8c40b2072fdda152703b84081719936b5f4e
(cherry picked from commit 54fc39308277d4aedc3e399286714d719ecacfbb)

commit_message:
Adding Publisher Acknowledgements/confirms

During the vancouver summit, Michael Klishin from
pivotal proposed we should use publisher confirms
as the default setting to reduce messages being
dropped on the floor.

https://www.rabbitmq.com/confirms.html
http://www.rabbitmq.com/blog/2011/02/10/introducing-publisher-confirms/

This setting is a lightweight way of keeping track of which messages
have been processed by the broker and which would need re-publishing
in case of broker shutdown or network failure.

Change-Id: I25bc955df130dad4725f5281211d37fd73e7ea63

commit_message:
Allow override of os-brick library used by cinder

os-brick code was pulled out of cinder and made into its own library
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/155552/

added to requirements:
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/177372/

Integration tests were added
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/188156/

But they still use the version of os-brick from pip.

This change updates devstack to pull in the changes from
os-brick patch sets instead, when configured to do so.

Needed-by: Id2bc10782847861fe4bb5e9e46245654450e38fd

Change-Id: I5359dd37dfe94bd469d5ca35f9fbaeda61b5fac4

commit_message:
Add default_client_name in Nova::FloatingIPAssoc

default_client_name has been missed, so stack fails
to delete, if server, from which floating ip association
depends, not exist.

Change-Id: I01bb91f8afaeb483e1a4bb55653dc3189a62bf12
Closes-bug: #1396982
(cherry picked from commit 898f94347dc011aba7f2cb03b1ff5d384691aeda)

commit_message:
Convert SyncPoint.entity_id from String to Integer

The sync point entity id is a string field currently that can take
either the value of a stack.id or a resource.id. Now that stack.id
and resource.id are both integers, change the field type to Integer
too.

Change-Id: I846d3b483a964e14450b67d59321dcdf50817111

commit_message:
docs: fixup libvirt NUMA testing docs to match reality

The libvirt NUMA testing docs were written before the final code
was merged, so the example JSON shown for the database fields
did not match reality. It was also hard to read the JSON since
there were no line breaks & indentation. To make matters even
worse, the final example was just plain wrong - the data shown
was a mixture of a guest with 1 NUMA node and a guest with 2
NUMA nodes.

Change-Id: I51e4df2d9fe252ba65f6a37d84f125e18b44e239

[{'created': '2015-05-15 14:40:50.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Add running functional scripts for defined backend

This CR allows running "functional" tox job for different backends.
Short description about expected workflow:
1. Gate job run ceilometer/ceilometer/tests/functional/hooks/post_test_hook.py
with <backend> parameter.
2. This script run "tox -efunctional" command with defined variable
CEILOMETER_TEST_BACKEND
3. After in "run-functional-tests.sh" setup script for the backend
and testr are runned.

In this CR running testr with pretty_tox.sh script added because
it allows to use subunit-trace output which developed in tempest-lib
and improve useful of testr output.

Partially implements: blueprint ceilometer-functional-tests
Change-Id: Idb66aca0b46779516db2baec856df8223dbe5c13

commit_message:
Add running functional scripts for defined backend

This CR allows running "functional" tox job for different backends.
Short description about expected workflow:
1. Gate job run ceilometer/ceilometer/tests/functional/hooks/post_test_hook.py
with <backend> parameter.
2. This script run "tox -efunctional" command with defined variable
CEILOMETER_TEST_BACKEND
3. After in "run-functional-tests.sh" setup script for the backend
and testr are runned.

In this CR running testr with pretty_tox.sh script added because
it allows to use subunit-trace output which developed in tempest-lib
and improve useful of testr output.

Partially implements: blueprint ceilometer-functional-tests
Change-Id: Idb66aca0b46779516db2baec856df8223dbe5c13

commit_message:
Add testcases to test DefaultDomain

As to the external authentication methods, we have `KerberosDomain`, `Domain`
and `DefaultDomain` defined, `DefaultDomain` is a different usecase compared
with `KerberosDomain` and `Domain`.

We have testcases for `KerberosDomain` and `Domain`, but there is no testcase
to verify `DefaultDomain`, so we need to fix it up.

Change-Id: Iec3e9a44c0b6fa22305aaf05f2f2aa9bffbf7b49
Closes-Bug: #1459116

commit_message:
tenant-list updated to output Tenant Description

Updated the keystone tenant-list command to be able to display the
tenant  description. The description will be included only when --show-
description option is set to true.

Co-Authored-By: Yamini Sardana <yamini.sardana@tcs.com>
Co-Authored-By: Kamil Rykowski <kamil.rykowski@intel.com>

Change-Id: I8ef317e8be7bd8f35a83039ea280ac43fc48d74f
Closes-bug: #1398723

commit_message:
Fix "Quick Deploy" crash after re-login

Now error occurred when user presses "Quick Deploy" 
with expired token. After logging in, murano dashboard crashes. 

Also, the same behavior is seen when user tries to click "Quick Deploy"
 form on the separate window or page is expired.
 This fix allows to show requested form.

What is not are going to be fixed:
* Form became unmodal if opened in a separate window, like every other
  horizon form since all java script, that makes form modal remained on
  the previous page

* If form contained plus for dependency form creation - link won't work,
 since there is no required javascript code on a new page.

Change-Id: I44011a2d575303b93f3ce430fe1aeede971dbd99
Closes-Bug: #1397972

commit_message:
Fixed keystone user-role-list command error issue

While using token authentication, the user-role-list command is not able to get user-id and tenant-id with existing implementation.In the fix thease values are obtained using os_username and os_tenant_name.

Change-Id: I375f4a60f945c8d01f3cdb9d80d2a6c51c00fb26
Fixes: bug #1436445

subject: Fixed keystone user-role-list command error issue

While using token authentication, the user-role-list command is not able to get the user and tenant details. When this command is used without passing user and tenant details, an error message is displayed.

', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Fixed keystone user-role-list command error issue

While using token authentication, the user-role-list command is not able to get the user and tenant details. When this command is used without passing user and tenant details, an error message is displayed.

Change-Id: I149b7e2a8561affe6d434538a921f8eff78fad89
Fixes: bug #1436445

commit_message:
Cause gabbi to skip on no storage sooner

This avoids problems interacting with the global CONF used by
prepare_service that happen when the fixture is skipped. If we skip
before ever accessign the CONF we have a better known state.

This problem was discovered by comparing runs of the gabbi tests
with mongo and mysql (they only work with mongo, by design).

Change-Id: I9567fb0b37e68cd92f141697e4af8882c10a33f7

commit_message:
Create DHCP port for IPv6 subnet

There is a bug in dhcp agent code that when first port is created
in an IPv6 subnet, DHCP port is not automatically created.

This fix resolves this problem by removing the IP version check
in configure_dhcp_for_network method.

Change-Id: If3f405d367a7099d9f33d72d11ffcb7a393abe23
Closes-Bug: #1367500
(cherry picked from commit 1b66e11b5d8c0b3de0610ca02c3e10b6f64ae375)

commit_message:
IBP: accept removable block devices only from vendor list

fuel-agent should ignore removable block device if their vendor
isn't in approved vendor list.
It's a backport of what has been already implemented in
nailgun-agent.

Change-Id: I406eb4d9539f1be55f97dce73cf2f611941fabd4
Closes-Bug: #1462397

commit_message:
[stable/6.1]Fix find_host for non-vcenter deployment

After adding support of vcenter,
for tests where we check connectivity
by floating ip we start to ssh on compute if nova network is used. So this change start return controllers
ip in case if use_vcenter is false

Change-Id: I8952ee78e8b2b94a1998f57a59ae7fa33ddbf629
Closes-Bug: #1443893

commit_message:
Merge V2 and V2.1 cloudpipe functional tests

Currently v2 and v2.1 have separate functional tests and their
corresponding sample files. As v2 and v2.1 are supposed to be identical,
there is overhead to maintain two set of functional tests and sample files.
We can have one set of tests which can run for both v2 and v2.1.

This commit merges cloudpipe functional tests.

In V2 hypervsior API has following extensions
- os-cloudpipe
- os-cloudpipe-update

In V2.1 above extensions have been merged together in cloudpipe plugins

Change-Id: Idf76e584fc2ec9508d93edead48ffc90a8c25257

commit_message:
[IBP] Verify the filesystem after expanding it

Resizing filesystem is inherently dangerous operation and can fail
both due to hardware problems and software bugs. Therefore check the
filesystem after resizing it to prevent the greater damage.

While at it make sure Ubuntu FS images produced by fuel-agent can be
resized up to 8 TB.

Related-Bug: #1459665
Change-Id: Iefd4504a13a581309805b358900cb94c53f57e81
