commit_message:
Document the IPv6 subnet attributes

This introduces the possible settings for ipv6_ra_mode and
ipv6_address_mode. This table differs in many ways from the original
table[1], but contains clarifications that might be ported back over to
neutron-specs.

For instance, the combinations of ipv6_address_mode set with
ipv6_ra_mode unset, where the Neutron ML2 plugin has not implemented
these features have been specificed as "Not Implemented."

The only behavior for when ipv6_address_mode is set and ipv6_ra_mode is
set to "slaac" that has been defined, is spcified by the following
spec[2].

[1]: http://specs.openstack.org/openstack/neutron-specs/specs/juno/ipv6-radvd-ra.html

[2]: http://specs.openstack.org/openstack/neutron-specs/specs/juno/ipv6-provider-nets-slaac.html

Change-Id: Ie4c56cc502baa389a5ac5f654ee3f4fee5f4a041
Related-Bug: #1293897

subject: Optimizations for SCSI mappings
revisions:
[{'created': '2015-06-02 19:29:57.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Check for existing mapping of inst disk to mgmt

An attempt to add an already-exist mapping will result in a 500 error
from PowerVM.  As written, the disk driver's
connect_instance_disk_to_mgmt routine will swallow this error, move on
to the next VIOS, and try to add the mapping there.  If that VIOS also
already has the mapping, we run out of VIOSes and the entire method
fails.  If it doesn't, we add the (same) mapping there as well,
resulting in two equivalent mappings.

The caller of connect_instance_disk_to_mgmt simply expects as a
postcondition that an appropriate mapping (preferably just one) exists.
This change set modifies the method to check whether the VIOS it is
inspecting already has an appropriate mapping; and if so, it shorts out
successfully.

Change-Id: If928dafb527a8e828c85dfcf13f5a7228c567fe5
", 'number': 1}, {'created': '2015-06-02 19:56:14.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Check for existing mapping of inst disk to mgmt

An attempt to add an already-exist mapping will result in a 500 error
from PowerVM.  As written, the disk driver's
connect_instance_disk_to_mgmt routine will swallow this error, move on
to the next VIOS, and try to add the mapping there.  If that VIOS also
already has the mapping, we run out of VIOSes and the entire method
fails.  If it doesn't, we add the (same) mapping there as well,
resulting in two equivalent mappings.

The caller of connect_instance_disk_to_mgmt simply expects as a
postcondition that an appropriate mapping (preferably just one) exists.
This change set modifies the method to check whether the VIOS it is
inspecting already has an appropriate mapping; and if so, it shorts out
successfully.

Change-Id: If928dafb527a8e828c85dfcf13f5a7228c567fe5
", 'number': 2}, {'created': '2015-06-04 23:05:15.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Optimizations for SCSI mappings

Recent pypowervm changes in the scsi_mapper task library have enabled
specifying an already-retrieved VIOS wrapper instead of a VIOS UUID
(which is subsequently used to retrieve the VIOS wrapper).  Herein we
take advantage of those changes to minimize the number of expensive
PowerVM REST API calls.

Change-Id: If928dafb527a8e828c85dfcf13f5a7228c567fe5
', 'number': 3}, {'created': '2015-06-08 16:15:58.000000000', 'files': ['nova_powervm/tests/virt/powervm/disk/test_ssp.py', 'nova_powervm/tests/virt/powervm/disk/test_localdisk.py', 'nova_powervm/virt/powervm/disk/driver.py'], 'message': 'Optimizations for SCSI mappings

commit_message:
Optimizations for SCSI mappings

Recent pypowervm changes in the scsi_mapper task library have enabled
specifying an already-retrieved VIOS wrapper instead of a VIOS UUID
(which is subsequently used to retrieve the VIOS wrapper).  Herein we
take advantage of those changes to minimize the number of expensive
PowerVM REST API calls.

Change-Id: If928dafb527a8e828c85dfcf13f5a7228c567fe5

commit_message:
Update devstack to handle Trove/Neutron setups

Default Trove configuration (for task manager and service) don't
reflect the settings required for Neutron. Trove requires a
configuration that can only be done after neutron is up. This
introduces a new function called just before starting trove services.

Change-Id: I197ec2d3975f7b551590cf1f6c7d2cb42d479e25
Closes-Bug: #1435612

commit_message:
Add volume drivers for Infortrend Storage

Infortrend implement ISCSI and FC volume drivers for
EonStor DS product.
It manages storage by Infortrend CLI tool.

common_cli.py implements the basic Cinder Driver API.
infortrend_fc_cli.py and infortrend_iscsi_cli.py use them to
provide FC and iSCSI specific support.

Support features:
- Volume Create/Delete
- Volume Attach/Detach
- Snapshot Create/Delete
- Create Volume from Snapshot
- Get Volume Stats
- Copy Image to Volume
- Copy Volume to Image
- Clone Volume
- Extend Volume

Change-Id: I753f88072c9c073bcb44d203b70cd79ce1aac186
Implements: blueprint infortrend-iscsi-fc-volume-driver

subject: Init UUIDCache in test_instance_exists
revisions:
[{'created': '2015-06-08 17:28:51.000000000', 'files': ['nova_powervm/tests/virt/powervm/test_vm.py'], 'message': 'Init UUIDCache in test_instance_exists

Depending on the order in which tox runs tests,
nova-powervm.tests.virt.powervm.test_vm.TestVM.test_instance_exists can
fail *intermittently* with:

Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/home/jenkins/workspace/gate-nova-powervm-python27/.tox/py27/
local/lib/python2.7/site-packages/mock.py", line 1201, in patched
    return func(*args, **keywargs)
  File "nova_powervm/tests/virt/powervm/test_vm.py", line 289, in
test_instance_exists
    self.assertTrue(vm.instance_exists(*mock_parms))
  File "nova_powervm/virt/powervm/vm.py", line 229, in instance_exists
    uuid = cache.lookup(instance.name, fetch=False)
AttributeError: 'NoneType' object has no attribute 'lookup'

...because UUIDCache needs to be initialized (by calling its

The reliable way to reproduce the problem is to run this test case by
itself, e.g.

tox -e py27 -- nova-powervm.tests.virt.powervm.test_vm.TestVM.test_inst
ance_exists

Change-Id: I6584a8e390d0cc8d8bfe0b7de476d4c37de11a64
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Init UUIDCache in test_instance_exists

Depending on the order in which tox runs tests,
nova-powervm.tests.virt.powervm.test_vm.TestVM.test_instance_exists can
fail *intermittently* with:

Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/home/jenkins/workspace/gate-nova-powervm-python27/.tox/py27/
local/lib/python2.7/site-packages/mock.py", line 1201, in patched
    return func(*args, **keywargs)
  File "nova_powervm/tests/virt/powervm/test_vm.py", line 289, in
test_instance_exists
    self.assertTrue(vm.instance_exists(*mock_parms))
  File "nova_powervm/virt/powervm/vm.py", line 229, in instance_exists
    uuid = cache.lookup(instance.name, fetch=False)
AttributeError: 'NoneType' object has no attribute 'lookup'

...because UUIDCache needs to be initialized (by calling its
constructor) before it is used.

The reliable way to reproduce the problem is to run this test case by
itself, e.g.

tox -e py27 -- nova-powervm.tests.virt.powervm.test_vm.TestVM.test_inst
ance_exists

Change-Id: I6584a8e390d0cc8d8bfe0b7de476d4c37de11a64

Remove unused find_attribute_or_element()

find_attribute_or_element() is not used since the first commit
(c53d8e343e50d4cf7ea9a6a81258848c2d893bfb), then this patch removes
the method.

commit_message:
Build jessie ramdisk

Instructs DIB to use jessie instead of wheezy for the appliance
VM base.  This'll speed up boot time thanks to systemd.

Change-Id: Ie6a19c8c5029f55da5fb912211117fe9c7476779
Depends-On: Id4b997848edee21bdcfa3d9defedc69598eccfad

commit_message:
Preserve logs in logs/ folder

Add retention of logs from a test run in a delineated folder
so OpenStack CI can be configured to store the logs after a
completed test.

Change-Id: I8d686918649a69b8aab9e3c5d7faf3a79a42a4e8
Partial-Bug: 1459803

commit_message:
Flavor tests - use a digest cycle to test watches

This refactors the flavor test patch to use the digest cycle to
test watches. This fixes a dependency the prior version of the
tests had on the order of the code under test.

commit_message:
[Launch Instance Fix] Add Flavor Step Unit Tests

- flavor.js code coverage up to 80%

This patch adds unit tests for the flavor step.  These tests are focused
around the controller and its related components (no selenium tests or view
tests).

Co-Authored-By: Mike Hagedorn <mike.hagedorn@hp.com>

Change-Id: Ia9cca258eacc36ac279cf6d21ffa2197f58d9294
Partial-Bug: 1435869

commit_message:
Get the management partition at driver init

The pypowervm LPAR wrapper for the management partition is used for its
UUID, which is expected not to change.  It therefore makes sense to load
up this UUID once, at driver init time.

This change set also refactors/optimizes a few other lookups into their
highest common base class.

Change-Id: Id53fdf029c17f8296a7a9088548e0351a7901924

revisions:
[{'created': '2015-05-16 16:11:09.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Fix functional tests and tox 2.0 errors

With the recent update to tox 2.0.x, environment variables such as
OS_AUTH_URL are not passed by default, resulting in tests errors
mentionning Keystone authentication failures.

This patch reads credentials from the 'functional_creds.conf' config
file, like it is done in novaclient (see Sean Dague's commit 6379287)
and soon in glanceclient.

Reading credentials the old way (the environment) is still possible.

Change-Id: Ief0f050044ecd90a14bbaf044e2b93ade0a6173f
Related-Bug: #1455102
", 'number': 1}, {'created': '2015-05-17 08:12:30.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Fix functional tests and tox 2.0 errors

mentionning Keystone authentication failures.

This patch reads credentials from the 'functional_creds.conf' config
file, like it is done in novaclient (see Sean Dague's commit 6379287)
and soon in glanceclient.

Reading credentials the old way (the environment) is still possible.

commit_message:
Fix functional tests and tox 2.0 errors

With the recent update to tox 2.0.x, environment variables such as
OS_AUTH_URL are not passed by default, resulting in tests errors
mentionning Keystone authentication failures.

This patch reads credentials from the 'functional_creds.conf' config
file, like it is done in novaclient, glanceclient, manilaclient and
soon in cinderclient.

Reading credentials the old way (the environment) is still possible.

Change-Id: Ief0f050044ecd90a14bbaf044e2b93ade0a6173f
Closes-Bug: #1455102

commit_message:
Checkout devstack-gate master in periodic jobs

Periodic jobs don't have branch or ref set, so provide defaults
for those for the devstack-checkout (which now uses zuul-cloner
and therefore requires them).

Change-Id: I373b30de3e694ffe30b6b3819aaff6823777974e

Project admin fails to list role assignments for his project with
Project Scoped Token.
The issue is project admin in default policy file
(policy.v3cloudsample.json) does not have access to get details
of his project. Due to this, keystone assumes that the project
does not exist, and tries to get the project listing which again
fails.
This change updates the default policy file to let project
administrators to retrieve their own project details.

Closes-Bug: 1418702
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Fix for listing role assignments by project admin

Project admin fails to list role assignments for his project with
Project Scoped Token.
The issue is project admin in default policy file
(policy.v3cloudsample.json) does not have access to get details
of his project. Due to this, keystone assumes that the project
does not exist, and tries to get the project listing which again
fails.
This change updates the default policy file to let project
administrators to retrieve their own project details.

Change-Id: I4f257c3b955a10ff492cd909791a3c4469bd139c
Closes-Bug: 1418702

commit_message:
Bring Redhat support to acceptance tests

OpenStack Infra has jobs to run this on both Ubuntu Trusty and
OS7.

* Add minitest to Gemfile (dependency to run beaker on centos - see
  http://projects.theforeman.org/issues/2650 for details)
* separate nodepool files to have trusty & centos7 support in OS
* infra
* spec: add case for repo configuration and support
  RH systems.
* rabbitmq: install module from source
* apt: pin the module
* configure device_driver for LBaaS (update in Kilo)

Change-Id: If6c724243ba2e4932b1121b7b7f148d8b5a3f187
Closes-bug: #1444736

commit_message:
Set places to 0 in self.assertAlmostEqual()

We are checking time of thread run in test_impl_rabbit.py and sometimes
it can be a bit longer, because of server load.

Set places=0 instead of 1 to make tests less restrictive.

Change-Id: I2ef6f1474047e1da64402e93696cb73b4d3318e8

commit_message:
Reduce `magic` conf attribute usage

Connection class contains `magic` attribute conf, which contains (or at
least should contain) all config options. Set these config options as
class attributes to make the code more clear

Change-Id: Ib67f148e2ecf3def37e57d6e3359bced932fbc90

commit_message:
Bring Redhat support to acceptance tests

OpenStack Infra has jobs to run this on both Ubuntu Trusty and
OS7.

* Add minitest to Gemfile (dependency to run beaker on centos - see
  http://projects.theforeman.org/issues/2650 for details)

  infra
* install openstack_extras module
* install EPEL on RH systems

Closes-bug: #1444736

revisions:
[{'created': '2015-06-08 16:16:44.000000000', 'files': ['openstack_catalog/web/index.html'], 'message': 'Update GA tracking code

The OpenStack foundation maintains a Google Analytics
account for tracking access. The stats from this
account will be shared regularly with docaedo,
who will then share these stats with the appropriate
MLs (similar to how this has been handled by the
OpenStack docs team).

This commit updates the tracking code so visits to
the App Catalog are properly tracked by using a new
sub-code for GA and also sending anchor tags along
with the clicks.

Closes-Bug: 1461167

Change-Id: Ie87f6da290718e8b8dcc72f65f588161f923c03d
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Update GA tracking code

The OpenStack foundation maintains a Google Analytics
account for tracking access. The stats from this
account will be shared regularly with docaedo,
who will then share these stats with the appropriate
MLs (similar to how this has been handled by the
OpenStack docs team).

This commit updates the tracking code so visits to
the App Catalog are properly tracked by using a new
sub-code for GA and also sending anchor tags along
with the clicks.

Closes-Bug: 1461167

Change-Id: Ie87f6da290718e8b8dcc72f65f588161f923c03d

commit_message:
Check for NotFound exception in setUp() function

test_resize_server_confirm_from_stopped test works fine when executed
alone but during a group execution it tries to delete the same instance
multiple times.

setUp() function is modified so that it catches NotFound exception and
create a new server instead of rebuilding (=deleting and creating) the
previous one.

Change-Id: Ie411268e37e4348a2434b473cd84e151a0a18c09
Closes-Bug: #1459516

commit_message:
Set default event status to completed

Change I9a22e53ca872235e723798d8ce3cb146d88568ab altered the
processing order of the events which broke logic to populate
the event status as 'completed' by default. This broke the
network changed events from Neutron.

This change modifies the logic to preserve the default 'completed'
behavior and adjusts a unit tests to prevent a regression.

Closes-Bug: #1462851
Change-Id: I3f4d10740138f65d704d6f8fa4db06d3d0ed64cf

commit_message:
Config & deployments to update overcloud packages

This change adds config and deployment resources to trigger package
updates on nodes. The deployments are triggered by doing a stack-update
and setting one of the parameters to a unique value.

The intent is that rolling update will be controlled by setting
breakpoints on all of the UpdateDeployment resources inside the
role resource groups.

Change-Id: I56bbf944ecd6cbdbf116021b8a53f9f9111c134f

commit_message:
Remove floating_ip_source

Now that we can reliably determine the network service provider for all
the supported clouds, we can remove floating_ip_source as it would be
only used to determine if floating IPs are available.

To check if floating IPs are available, we can just query the extension
list of Nova or Neutron.

Change-Id: I266c11085e5ee739aa58e150219f84ed9d2c1575

subject: Allow overriding the network service provider
revisions:
[{'created': '2015-06-07 21:05:38.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Allow overriding the network service provider

The purpose of this patch is to make has_service() work again in the shade
library.

The catalog of some clouds lies: it say it supports a sevice (e.g. neutron)
but that service is not reachable. Rax is the most notable example.

With this patch we add 'network_provider', a new attribute, without default
value. Currently, the only vendor that needs this attribute is Rax.

Given this new attribute, we don't need to specify the floating_ip_source
anymore. And, we can determine if floating IPs are supported, looking at the
os-floating-ip nova extension.

We can do the same for secgroups (security-group extension of Neutron or
SecurityGroups extension of Nova), but that would be better handled by a
separate patch.

Change-Id: I6eec5e58c72ec2cb80f926fca40ffef0d07df93b

commit_message:
Allow overriding the network service provider

The purpose of this patch is to make has_service() work again in the
shade library.

The catalog of some clouds lies: it say it supports a sevice (e.g.
neutron) but that service is not reachable. Rax is the most notable
example.

With this patch we add 'network_provider', a new attribute, without
default value. Currently, the only vendor that needs this attribute
is Rax.

Given this new attribute, we don't need to specify the
floating_ip_source anymore because we can determine if floating IPs are
supported just looking at the os-floating-ip nova extension.
We can do the same for secgroups (security-group extension of Neutron
or SecurityGroups extension of Nova), but removing these attributes
could break backward compatibility and it would be better handled in
separate patches.

Change-Id: I6eec5e58c72ec2cb80f926fca40ffef0d07df93b

commit_message:
Rebase on pypowervm scsi_mapper VIOS returns

Recent changes in pypowervm have the methods in
pypowervm.tasks.scsi_mapper return the VIOS EntryWrapper for the Virtual
I/O server that was changed.  This change set rebases accordingly.

Change-Id: I5cd0c58a28ed346887d9a2e4d2bd3b1c22fc5368

Unit tests for @deprecated are generalized, and those applicable for

both deprecation classes.

For reference, the particular need for such a decorator arised in one of

Closes-Bug: #1461043

commit_message:
Introduce @deprecated_parameter decorator

It can be used to deprecate specific arguments for a callable, while
leaving callable intact in terms of deprecation.

Unit tests for @deprecated are generalized, and those applicable for
@deprecated_parameter are moved into a common mixin class to reuse for
both deprecation classes.

For reference, the particular need for such a decorator arised in one of
neutron reviews: I8a5c02712a0b43f3e36a4f14620ebbd73fbfb03f

Change-Id: If396f8ea7d6d31e67ae7f9fb223b21982f97ce7a
Closes-Bug: #1461043

commit_message:
Update ipset members when corresponding sg member is empty

if a security group has a rule with 'remote-group-id', the ports
in this security group should update its relevant ipset member
when the remote-group members is empty.

Change-Id: I980ebfd8f6537f803d9d5cbf21ca33f727fea3b3
Closes-bug: #1458786

commit_message:
Make sure sysrq functions are enabled in reboot.sh

This commit echoes '1' to >/proc/sys/kernel/sysrq to
make sure that sysrq functions are enabled before
invoking them.

Change-Id: I88697efbc1bd0dec5ed4cbcd8d89b0b5d0734bdd

commit_message:
Remove WritableLogger wrapper

After new release of oslo.log (1.2.0), we got messages about deprecation
of WritableLogger. We need to remove that.

Change-Id: I5627f2f7524b1a08f3179ee4bf85eabfea14d7a9
Depends-On:Ied2cace0a54126f093ded89e355d3d2a23204261
Closes-bug: 1461057

revisions:
[{'created': '2015-06-02 21:05:07.000000000', 'files': ['sahara/config.py'], 'message': 'Disable neutron DEBUG logs

We are retrieving ALL neutron objects to check quotas. This could
lead to logs flooding.

Ideally quotas usage check should be done on neutron side, but it
looks there is no way to do that. Horizon retrieves all neutron
objects too.

So, just disabling DEBUG for neutron client.

Change-Id: Ic5f28c76e5d1a628e0323efa8fe3980577ca37a5
Closes-Bug: #1459794
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Disable neutron DEBUG logs

We are retrieving ALL neutron objects to check quotas. This could
lead to logs flooding.

Ideally quotas usage check should be done on neutron side, but it
looks there is no way to do that. Horizon retrieves all neutron
objects too.

So, just disabling DEBUG for neutron client.

Change-Id: Ic5f28c76e5d1a628e0323efa8fe3980577ca37a5
Closes-Bug: #1459794

commit_message:
Add "null" for fields in cluster and node group template JSON schemas

* Change 'type' for optional fields to list including 'null'

* Allow the default template tool to use "None" to
unset fields with replacement values when no replacement has been
specified.

* Fix cluster template update code to check for explicit setting of
the 'node_groups' field in a cluster template update

Partial-Bug: #1438077
Closes-Bug: #1439839

commit_message:
Enable NetApp Backends in Cinder

Enables support for configuring Cinder with a NetApp backend.
This change adds all relevant parameters for:
 - Clustered Data ONTAP (NFS, iSCSI, FC)
 - Data ONTAP 7-Mode (NFS, iSCSI, FC)
 - E-Series (iSCSI)

Change-Id: If6c6e511ef2d26c4794e3b37c61e5318485ff4db

subject: Setup logging in the appliance
revisions:
[{'created': '2015-06-04 22:44:15.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Setup logging in the appliance

The appliance currently tries to log to /tmp/gunicorn.log, but thats
misconfigured.  This sets gunicorn up to log to /var/log/akanda/ for
both access and error logs and installs and configures logrotate for
those files.

Change-Id: Ie75f305860a0c5204ec8fe5b1af0de03826aa880
', 'number': 1}, {'created': '2015-06-05 18:18:39.000000000', 'files': ['ansible/templates/gunicorn.j2', 'ansible/tasks/akanda.yml', 'ansible/templates/logrotate.j2'], 'message': 'Setup logging in the appliance

The appliance currently tries to log to /tmp/gunicorn.log, but thats
misconfigured.  This sets gunicorn up to log to /var/log/akanda/ for

Change-Id: Ie75f305860a0c5204ec8fe5b1af0de03826aa880
', 'number': 2}]
commit_message:
Setup logging in the appliance

The appliance currently tries to log to /tmp/gunicorn.log, but thats
misconfigured.  This sets gunicorn up to log to /var/log/akanda/ for
both access and error logs and installs and configures logrotate for
those files.

Change-Id: Ie75f305860a0c5204ec8fe5b1af0de03826aa880

subject: Add value format for list command
revisions:
[{'created': '2015-05-13 19:10:49.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Add value format for list command

The value format for the show command is very handy for shell
scripting and a value format for the list command would be just
as handy.  It will allow command substitution and piping like:

    os container list --format value | grep tmp | while read NAME
    do
      os container delete $NAME
    done

Change-Id: If9784c27d689073e9145b2cb8077ac604025a4c3

The value format for the show command is very handy for shell

commit_message:
Add value format for list command

The value format for the show command is very handy for shell
scripting and a value format for the list command would be just
as handy.  It will allow command substitution and piping like:

    os container list --format value | grep tmp | while read NAME
    do
      os container delete $NAME
    done

Change-Id: If9784c27d689073e9145b2cb8077ac604025a4c3

commit_message:
Use install_default_policy

Recent versions of oslo-incubator/policy expects to find a
`policy.d` dir inside $PROJECT_CONF_DIR. Otherwise it would
log the message  "Can not find policy directory: policy.d".

This modifies install_default_policy to ensure the directory is
created and adds a note about why.  The projects are converted to use
this function rather than copy by hand.  Some minor changes are
required to handle layout differences between projects.

Change-Id: I335a661d307a330e8b59883ef60c787c6590eb42

revisions:
[{'created': '2015-04-10 09:35:11.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "tests: don't allow oslo.config to autodiscover config files

oslo.config makes attempts to autodiscover configuration files using
find_config_files() helper. If e.g. /etc/neutron/neutron.conf exists,
and is not readable, the following test failure can be experienced:

oslo_config.cfg.ConfigFilesPermissionDeniedError: Failed to open some
config files: /etc/neutron/neutron.conf

Unit tests must not rely on any external state of the system and run
successfully no matter whether neutron is actually installed on the
system, or not.

Closes-Bug: #1442543
Change-Id: Ic90d8c40b2072fdda152703b84081719936b5f4e
", 'number': 1}, {'created': '2015-05-12 11:44:15.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/tests/base.py'], 'message': "tests: don't allow oslo.config to autodiscover config files

oslo.config makes attempts to autodiscover configuration files using
find_config_files() helper. If e.g. /etc/neutron/neutron.conf exists,
and is not readable, the following test failure can be experienced:

oslo_config.cfg.ConfigFilesPermissionDeniedError: Failed to open some
config files: /etc/neutron/neutron.conf

Unit tests must not rely on any external state of the system and run
successfully no matter whether neutron is actually installed on the
system, or not.

Closes-Bug: #1442543
Change-Id: Ic90d8c40b2072fdda152703b84081719936b5f4e
", 'number': 2}]
commit_message:
tests: don't allow oslo.config to autodiscover config files

oslo.config makes attempts to autodiscover configuration files using
find_config_files() helper. If e.g. /etc/neutron/neutron.conf exists,
and is not readable, the following test failure can be experienced:

oslo_config.cfg.ConfigFilesPermissionDeniedError: Failed to open some
config files: /etc/neutron/neutron.conf

Unit tests must not rely on any external state of the system and run
successfully no matter whether neutron is actually installed on the
system, or not.

Closes-Bug: #1442543
Change-Id: Ic90d8c40b2072fdda152703b84081719936b5f4e

commit_message:
Include NetApp Cinder Dependencies in Images

The NetApp drivers for Cinder will need to use these protocols:
 - iSCSI (iscsi-initiator-utils)
 - NFS (nfs-utils)
 - Fibre Channel (no packages needed)

Change-Id: I78edde345689333091b8d0d39e1436fa92db8c5a

commit_message:
Allow oslo rabbit heartbeat configuration

In order to allow components to better handle and respond to mq failures,
oslo has some heartbeat options that are useful.

commit_message:
Improve disk-unit angular filters

Bug 1447814: The Bytes filter should go up to petabyte values.  (The
python equivelents do, so don't lose feature parity.)

Refactor of the gb and mb filters.
Added pb, tb, and kb filters.
bytes filter now accepts specific label.

Change-Id: I14acf2a89e02b26bf6d1329b15d641bba7e2a5ce
Closes-Bug: #1447814
Closes-Bug: #1447818

commit_message:
Allow relative names in record-create

Currently record-create requires absolute names. This change allows to
provide relative (to the domain) names with the new option --relative.

Change-Id: I78258ea734a4105fae8f9f3ef30fe86e018b5388
Closes-Bug: #1444452

commit_message:
Allow for building non-wheezy releases

This makes the kernel update task only happen on wheezy and removes
the default release stuff from bird (the newer backports version should be
installed without pinning to that repo)

Change-Id: Id4b997848edee21bdcfa3d9defedc69598eccfad

commit_message:
Bump gunicorn worker timeout to 60

The default 30s worker timeout for gunicorn is not sufficient for
some slower environments, as the metadata service takes a while to
restart.  This bumps it to 60s to ensure we dont fail config updates
on worker timeouts.

Change-Id: If27329b58d97e6aef687a069615dbda763dba8c1
Closes-bug: #1462100

commit_message:
Make router_instance_flavor a StrOpt

Nova supports non-int flavor IDs (ie, UUIDs). Update the config and make
this setting a string, not int.

commit_message:
devstack: Create a custom nova flavor for the appliance

m1.small is overkill for our purposes, but a micro is too small for our
image.  This creates a flavor with bigger disk support but less memory.

Change-Id: I1f4072e864f956df10511ec75b4a043ef7f4d838

commit_message:
Pass response body down into RestClientExceptions

This commit adds support to RestClientException objects to store the
response body as a local attr. Additionally it modifies all the uses
of the subclassed RestClientExceptions in the base rest client to
store the response body on each error type.

This is done in order to check the content in some occasion that
additional error details are coming back from a service in the body.
It will be useful to have the resp_body passed into the exception so
that it can be used in additional checks.

Change-Id: Ie1bb259e7e683081f0ad127617acc8deb98467c0

commit_message:
Adding user_id handling to keypair create api call

Allowing the administrator to be able to create new
keypairs on behalf of their users

Related to blueprint admin-query-any-keypair

Fixed incorrectly reported location of duplicate code.
Some new code checks added:
W0612(unused-variable): Unused variable 'e'
W0613(unused-argument): Unused argument 'x'
C1001(old-style-class): Old-style class defined

commit_message:
Attempt to make pylint output more useful

Fixed incorrectly reported location of duplicate code.
Some new code checks added:
W0612(unused-variable): Unused variable 'e'
W0613(unused-argument): Unused argument 'x'
C1001(old-style-class): Old-style class defined

Change-Id: I7e20d9347c672f1df6fc3c270fc966f0a570ef6a

commit_message:
New "logical architecture" page in cloud admin guide

The text on this page seems to be copied directly from a
developer guide and is largely irrelevant for admins.
Text must be rewritten, and the diagram, which depicts
the situation at Havana time, must be redrawn.

Change-Id: I8f0a9538661292619bd8375ae03d20fe3cee2b5e
Closes-Bug: #1431079

commit_message:
Intern-based unit tests

This commit adds unit-tests runner for UI and 1 test suite for
the expression parser. It also makes --webui flag for run_tests.sh
run all the UI tests: lint checks, unit tests, functional tests.

Change-Id: I6176dc01cdd6d2bcf7a99185e92cc498c7b2b899
